  4782                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4783                                  
  4784                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4785                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4786                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4787                                  
  4788                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4789                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4790                                  		;=============================================================
  4791                                  		;
  4792                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4793                                  		;
  4794                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4795                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4796                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4797                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4798                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4799                                  
  4800                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4801                                  		;=============================================================
  4802                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4803                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4804                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4805                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4806                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4807                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4808                                  		
  4809                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4810                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4811                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs
  4812                                  
  4813                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4814                                  		;cli	; not necessary at this stage
  4815                                  
  4816                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4817                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4818                                  		;push	ax
  4819                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4820                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4821                                  		;pop	ax
  4822                                  	
  4823                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4824                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4825                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4826                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4827                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4828                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4829                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4830                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4831                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4832                                  
  4833                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4834                                  
  4835                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4836                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4837                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4838                                  
  4839 00001622 2EA3[8015]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4840 00001626 2E891E[7E15]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4841                                  
  4842                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4843                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4844                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4845                                  
  4846 0000162B 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4847 0000162C 07                      		pop	es
  4848                                  
  4849 0000162D 51                      		push	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4850                                  		;push	di ; *! (not necessary) ; 12/12/2023
  4851                                  
  4852                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4853                                  		; ds <> cs
  4854                                  		; ds = relocated MSLOAD segment, cs = BIOSDATA segment
  4855                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4856                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4857                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4858                                  		; ds = cs
  4859 0000162E 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4860 00001630 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4861                                  		; ds = 0
  4862                                  
  4863 00001632 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4864                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4865                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4866                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4867 00001634 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4868                                  
  4869                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4870 00001637 FA                      		cli
  4871                                  next_int_:		
  4872 00001638 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4873 00001639 AC                      		lodsb		
  4874                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4875 0000163A 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4876 0000163B D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4877 0000163D D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4878 0000163F 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4879 00001641 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4880                                  					; saving address in di
  4881                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4882                                  		;stosw
  4883                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4884                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4885                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4886 00001643 A5                      		movsw
  4887 00001644 A5                      		movsw
  4888                                  
  4889 00001645 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4890 00001647 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4891                                  
  4892                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4893                                  		;pop	di  ; *!
  4894                                  		;pop	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4895                                  
  4896                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4897                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4898                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4899                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4900                                  
  4901                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4902                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4903                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4904                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4905                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4906                                  
  4907                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4908 00001649 C7064C00[4607]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4909                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4910                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4911 0000164F 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4912                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4913 00001653 C7065400[F507]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4914                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4915                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4916 00001659 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4917                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4918 0000165D C7066400[B507]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4919                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4920                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4921 00001663 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4922                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4923                                  
  4924                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4925 00001667 0E                      		push	cs
  4926 00001668 1F                      		pop	ds
  4927                                  		
  4928 00001669 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4929 0000166C A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4930 0000166F A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4931 00001672 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4932                                  					; ;
  4933 00001675 FB                      		sti
  4934 00001676 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4935                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4936                                  
  4937                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4938                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4939                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4940                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4941                                  ;
  4942                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4943                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c". so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4944                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4945                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4946                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4947                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4948                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4949                                  
  4950                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4951                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4952                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4953                                  ;
  4954                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4955                                  ; to do anything special.
  4956                                  ;
  4957                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4958                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4959                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4960                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4961                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4962                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4963                                  
  4964                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4965 00001678 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4966                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4967 0000167A 7524                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4968                                  
  4969                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4970                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4971                                  ;
  4972                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4973                                  ;
  4974                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4975                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4976                                  
  4977                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4978                                  		; ((cx is already on top of the stack))
  4979                                  		;push	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4980                                  		;push	bx	; not necessary
  4981 0000167C 50                      		push	ax
  4982 0000167D 52                      		push	dx
  4983                                  		;push	di	; not necessary
  4984 0000167E 06                      		push	es
  4985                                  
  4986 0000167F B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4987 00001681 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4988 00001683 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4989                                  					; DL = drive number
  4990                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4991                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4992                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4993 00001685 7204                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  4994                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4995                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4996                                  		; ds = cs
  4997 00001687 8816[2116]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4998                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4999                                  		; 12/12/2023
  5000 0000168B 07                      		pop	es
  5001                                  		;pop	di
  5002 0000168C 5A                      		pop	dx
  5003 0000168D 58                      		pop	ax
  5004                                  		;pop	bx
  5005                                  		; 13/12/2023
  5006                                  		;pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  5007 0000168E 7210                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  5008                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  5009                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  5010                                  
  5011                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5012                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  5013                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  5014                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  5015 00001690 A0[2116]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  5016 00001693 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  5017 00001695 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  5018                                  
  5019                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  5020                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5021 00001697 48                      		dec	ax
  5022 00001698 EB0A                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  5023                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5024                                  
  5025                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  5026                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5027                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  5028                                  		; 10/12/2023
  5029 0000169A 40                      		inc	ax ; al = 1
  5030 0000169B A2[9115]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  5031                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  5032                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  5033                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  5034 0000169E EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  5035                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5036                                  
  5037                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  5038 000016A0 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  5039 000016A2 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  5040                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  5041                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  5042                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5043 000016A4 2403                    		and	al, 3
  5044 000016A6 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  5045 000016A8 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  5046                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  5047                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5048                                  		; ds = cs
  5049 000016A9 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  5050                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  5051                                  notsingle:				
  5052 000016AD 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  5053                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  5054                                  					; booted off hard file
  5055                                  		; 13/12/2023
  5056 000016AE 59                      		pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  5057                                  
  5058 000016AF 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  5059                                  
  5060                                  ; 16/10/2022
  5061                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  5062                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  5063                                  BRKADR	EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  5064                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt

  5066                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters

  5069

  5073 000016B4 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.

  5086                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  5087                                  		;sti
  5088

  5092                                  		
  5093                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  5094                                  
  5095 000016BC B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  5096 000016BE CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  5097 000016C0 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  5098 000016C2 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  5099 000016C5 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  5100

  5106                                  					; get/save model byte

  5113                                  
  5114                                  no_rom_system_conf:

  5119 000016E0 A2[2D06]                		mov	[model_byte], al

  5121                                  turn_timer_on:

  5123 000016E5 E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.
  5124                                  					; AKPORT
  5125                                  
  5126                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  5127                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running
  5128                                  ; on one of those, we must inhibit the normal aux port initialization

  5143 000016FC 7414                    		jz	short skip_aux_port_init ; take	this branch if 8530 installed

  5354                                  ; is installed, and we are going to set keyrd_func to 10h, keysts_func to 11h

  5383                                  ;	will initialize the number of drives

  5386                                  ;

  5451                                  					; DL = drive number

  5453                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  5455 0000184C 7204                    		jc	short enddrv

  5459 00001852 0E                      		push	cs
  5460 00001853 07                      		pop	es
  5461                                  
  5462                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5463                                  ; diskette drives:
  5464                                  ;
  5465                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5466                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5467                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5468                                  ;
  5469                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5470                                  ;
  5471                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5472                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5473                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5474                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5475                                  					
  5476 00001854 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl
  5477                                  
  5478                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5479                                  		; ds = cs
  5480                                  		;push	cs
  5481                                  		;pop	ds
  5482                                  
  5483 00001856 C606[2C01]09            		mov	byte [eot], 9
  5484 0000185B BF[1901]                		mov	di, start_bds 	; if we	are faking floppy drives we need
  5485                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5486                                  
  5487                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5488                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5489                                  
  5490                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5491                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5492                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5493                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5494                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5495                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5496                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5497                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5498                                  
  5499 0000185E 803E[9115]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  5500 00001863 750B                    		jnz	short loop_drive

  5502                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  5503 00001867 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5504                                  					; di <-	second bds link

  5540                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  5550                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  5551                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  5552                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic
  5553                                  ; diskette which need msbio,msdos to boot up before it sets cmos.
  5554                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.

  5926                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  5927                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5928                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5929                                  ;

  5931                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5932                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5933                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5934                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5935                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.

  5948                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5949                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5950                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5951                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5952                                  ;
  5953                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5954                                  ;
  5955                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5956                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5957                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5958                                  ;use to start with.
  5959                                  ;
  5960                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5961                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5962                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5963                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5964                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5965

  5970                                  ;   3.	 end of bdss	; end of bdss for hard disks

  5972                                  ;   5.	 endcmosclockset;supporting program for cmos clock write.

  6048                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  6049                                  ;
  6050                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  6051                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  6052                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  6053                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  6054                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  6055                                  ; off of it.
  6056                                  ;
  6057                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  6058                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  6059                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  6060                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  6061                                  ; when to install the hook.
  6062                                  
  6063                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  6064                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  6065                                  checkcompaqbug:
  6066                                  		; 21/12/2022

  6069                                  		;mov	es, ax

  6075 00001A24 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  6076                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  6077 00001A2B 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  6078 00001A2D 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  6079                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  6080 00001A34 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  6081                                  
  6082                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  6083

  6373                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  6374                                  ;
  6375                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  6376                                  
  6377                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  6378                                  
  6379                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6380                                  ; module name: remap
  6381                                  ;
  6382                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  6383                                  ;
  6384                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  6385                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  6386                                  ;
  6387                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  6388                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  6389                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  6390                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  6391                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  6392                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  6393                                  
  6394                                  ; input:       none
  6395                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  6396                                  ; exit error:  none
  6397                                  ; called from: msinit
  6398                                  ;
  6399                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6400                                  ;	  found in the system
  6401                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6402                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6403                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6404                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6405                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6406                                  ;
  6407                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6408                                  
  6409                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6410                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6411                                  		; 15/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1) IBMBIO.COM
  6412                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2464h)
  6413                                  		; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSDATA:1D9Eh)
  6414                                  
  6415                                  remap:		; proc near
  6416                                  
  6417                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6418                                  		; ds = cs
  6419                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6420 00001B11 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]
  6421                                  
  6422                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6423                                  
  6424                                  drive_loop:
  6425 00001B15 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6426                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6427 00001B19 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6428 00001B1B 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6429                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6430 00001B1D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1 ; 0FFFFh	; last bds?
  6431 00001B20 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6432 00001B22 EB49                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6433                                  
  6434                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6435                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6436                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6437                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6438                                  
  6439                                  fdrv_found:
  6440 00001B24 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6441                                  fdrv_loop:
  6442 00001B26 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6443 00001B29 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6444                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6445                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6446                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6447 00001B2B 40                      		inc	ax
  6448 00001B2C 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  6449 00001B2F 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  6450                                  
  6451                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6452                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6453                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6454                                  ; any more.
  6455                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6456                                  
  6457                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6458                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6459 00001B31 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  6460 00001B35 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6461                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6462                                  		;mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6463 00001B37 8A26[2501]              		mov	ah, [dsktnum]
  6464 00001B3B 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6465                                  remap_loop1:
  6466 00001B3E 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6467                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6468 00001B40 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6469 00001B43 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6470 00001B45 FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  6471 00001B47 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6472                                  
  6473                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6474                                  
  6475                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6476                                  		;mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6477 00001B49 A0[7C15]                		mov	al, [drvfat]
  6478 00001B4C 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6479 00001B4E 721D                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6480                                  		;sub	al, [cs:dsktnum]
  6481 00001B50 2A06[2501]              		sub	al, [dsktnum]	; is it one of the other floppies?
  6482 00001B54 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6483                                  
  6484                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6485                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6486                                  
  6487 00001B56 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6488 00001B58 EB04                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6489                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6490                                  
  6491                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6492                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6493                                  
  6494                                  remap_boot_flop:
  6495                                  		;add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6496                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6497 00001B5A 0206[7500]              		add	al, [drvmax]
  6498                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6499                                  		;mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6500 00001B5E A2[7C15]                		mov	[drvfat], al
  6501 00001B61 FEC0                    		inc	al
  6502 00001B63 1E                      		push	ds
  6503 00001B64 BF3A04                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6504                                  		;mov	di, 544h	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6505                                  		;;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6506 00001B67 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6507 00001B69 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6508                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6509                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6510 00001B6C 1F                      		pop	ds ; ds = cs
  6511                                  rmap_exit:
  6512 00001B6D C3                      		retn
  6513                                  
  6514                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6515                                  
  6516                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6517                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6518                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6519                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6520                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6521                                  ;**************************************************
  6522                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6523                                  ;
  6524                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6525                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6526                                  ;
  6527                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6528                                  ;**************************************************
  6529                                  
  6530                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6531                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6532                                  
  6533                                  getboot:	; proc near
  6534                                  
  6535                                  		; 15/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 
  6536                                  		;	 (Modified MSDOS 6.22) IO.SYS
  6537                                  		; ds = cs
  6538                                  		
  6539                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6540                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6541                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6542                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6543                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6544                                  
  6545                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6546                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6547 00001B6E A1[8715]                		mov	ax, [init_bootseg]
  6548 00001B71 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6549                                  
  6550                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6551 00001B73 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6552                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6553                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6554 00001B76 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6555 00001B79 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6556 00001B7B B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6557 00001B7E CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6558                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6559                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6560                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6561 00001B80 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6562                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6563 00001B82 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6564                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6565                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6566 00001B89 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6567                                  erret:
  6568 00001B8B F9                      		stc
  6569                                  norm_ret:
  6570 00001B8C C3                      		retn
  6571                                  
  6572                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6573                                  		
  6574                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22)
  6575                                  
  6576                                  chk_partition_type:
  6577                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6578 00001B8D 268A07                  		mov	al, [es:bx]	; partition type
  6579                                  
  6580                                  		; see if partitiontype == 1, 4, 6
  6581 00001B90 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; FAT12
  6582 00001B92 7406                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  6583 00001B94 3C04                    		cmp	al, 4		; FAT16 CHS (<= 32MB)
  6584 00001B96 7402                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  6585 00001B98 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; FAT16 BIG CHS (> 32MB)
  6586                                  chk_ptype_retn:
  6587                                  		; zf = 1 -> primary DOS partition
  6588                                  		; zf = 0 -> not a primary DOS partition
  6589 00001B9A C3                      		retn
  6590                                  
  6591                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6592                                  
  6593                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6594                                  
  6595                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6596                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6597                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6598                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6599                                  ;   determine version number
  6600                                  ;
  6601                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6602                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6603                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6604                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6605                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6606                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6607                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6608                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6609                                  
  6610                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6611                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6612                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6613                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6614 00001B9B 57                      		push	di
  6615 00001B9C 53                      		push	bx
  6616                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 14/08/2023
  6617 00001B9D 06                      		push	es
  6618 00001B9E 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6619 00001BA1 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6620 00001BA4 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6621                                  					; fnon_removable
  6622 00001BA8 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6623                                  					; ffHardFile
  6624 00001BAC C606[8415]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6625 00001BB1 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6626 00001BB3 52                      		push	dx
  6627 00001BB4 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6628 00001BB6 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6629                                  					; DL = drive number
  6630                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6631                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6632                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6633 00001BB8 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6634 00001BBA 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6635 00001BBD 5A                      		pop	dx
  6636 00001BBE 7249                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6637 00001BC0 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6638 00001BC3 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6639 00001BC6 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6640 00001BC7 E8A4FF                  		call	getboot
  6641 00001BCA 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6642 00001BCB 723C                    		jb	short setret
  6643 00001BCD BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6644                                  
  6645                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6646                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6647                                  
  6648                                  act_part:
  6649 00001BD0 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6650 00001BD5 740B                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6651                                  ; 16/12/2023
  6652                                  %if 0
  6653                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6654                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  6655                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6656                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  6657                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6658                                  		jnz	short no_act
  6659                                  %endif
  6660                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22)
  6661                                  		; check if it is a primary dos partition
  6662                                  
  6663 00001BD7 E8B3FF                  		call	chk_partition_type
  6664 00001BDA 7506                    		jne	short no_act
  6665                                  
  6666                                  got_good_act:
  6667 00001BDC 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6668 00001BDE 742D                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6669 00001BE0 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6670                                  no_act:
  6671 00001BE2 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6672 00001BE5 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6673                                  					; last entry done?
  6674 00001BE9 75E5                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6675 00001BEB BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6676                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6677                                  
  6678                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6679                                  
  6680                                  get_primary:				
  6681 00001BEE 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6682 00001BF3 750B                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6683                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6684                                  ; 16/12/2023
  6685                                  %if 0
  6686                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6687                                  		jz	short got_prim
  6688                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6689                                  		jz	short got_prim
  6690                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6691                                  		jnz	short not_prim
  6692                                  %endif
  6693                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22)
  6694                                  		; check if it is a primary dos partition
  6695                                  
  6696 00001BF5 E895FF                  		call	chk_partition_type
  6697 00001BF8 7506                    		jne	short not_prim
  6698                                  
  6699                                  got_prim:
  6700 00001BFA 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6701 00001BFC 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6702 00001BFE FECE                    		dec	dh
  6703                                  not_prim:
  6704 00001C00 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6705 00001C03 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6706 00001C07 75E5                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6707                                  setret:					
  6708 00001C09 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6709 00001C0A E98502                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6710                                  
  6711                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6712                                  
  6713                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6714                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6715                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6716                                  ;
  6717                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6718                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6719                                  ;  without change.
  6720                                  ;
  6721                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6722                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6723                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6724                                  
  6725                                  set2:
  6726                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6727                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6728 00001C0D 8816[8915]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6729                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6730                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6731 00001C11 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6732 00001C15 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6733                                  
  6734                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6735                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6736                                  
  6737 00001C19 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6738 00001C1C 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6739 00001C1F 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6740 00001C23 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6741 00001C27 7305                    		jnc	short okdrive
  6742 00001C29 800E[8415]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6743                                  okdrive:
  6744 00001C2E 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6745 00001C32 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6746                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6747 00001C35 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6748 00001C39 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6749 00001C3C 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6750 00001C40 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6751 00001C44 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6752 00001C47 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6753                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6754                                  		;cmp	dx, 0
  6755                                  		;ja	short okdrive_1
  6756                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6757 00001C4A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
  6758 00001C4C 7505                    		jnz	short okdrive_1
  6759 00001C4E 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6760 00001C51 72B6                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6761                                  okdrive_1:
  6762                                  		;mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6763                                  		;mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6764                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6765                                  		;push	ax ; *
  6766 00001C53 8B4519                  		mov	ax, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6767 00001C56 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6768                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6769 00001C58 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6770                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6771                                  		;push	ax
  6772                                  		;mov	ax, dx
  6773 00001C5B 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6774 00001C5D F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6775                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6776                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6777                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6778                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6779 00001C5F A3[1A05]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6780                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6781                                  		;pop	ax ; *
  6782 00001C62 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6783 00001C65 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6784 00001C67 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6785 00001C69 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6786                                  		;xor	bx, bx
  6787                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6788                                  		; bh = 0
  6789 00001C6B 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6790                                  		;push	ax ; *
  6791 00001C6E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6792                                  		;;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6793                                  		;mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 14/08/2023
  6794                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6795 00001C70 8706[1A05]              		xchg	ax, [temp_h] ; * (push ax)
  6796 00001C74 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6797                                  		;;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6798                                  		;mov	[temp_h], ax ; 14/08/2023
  6799                                  		;pop	ax ; *
  6800                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6801 00001C76 8706[1A05]              		xchg	ax, [temp_h] ; * (pop ax)
  6802 00001C7A F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6803                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6804 00001C7C 833E[1A05]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6805                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6806                                  		;ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6807                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6808 00001C81 7786                    		ja	short setret
  6809 00001C83 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6810                                  		;ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6811                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6812 00001C86 7781                    		ja	short setret
  6813                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6814                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6815                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6816                                  okdrive_2:
  6817                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6818                                  ; dl is head.
  6819                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6820                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6821                                  
  6822                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6823                                  
  6824 00001C88 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6825                                  					; check for mini disk
  6826 00001C8C 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6827 00001C8E 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6828                                  					; set the physical track number
  6829                                  oknotmini:
  6830                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6831                                  				
  6832 00001C91 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  6833 00001C93 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6834 00001C95 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  6835 00001C98 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  6836 00001C9A 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch iscylinder (low 8 bits)
  6837                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6838 00001C9C 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6839                                  		
  6840                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6841 00001C9E 8A16[8915]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  6842                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6843                                  
  6844                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6845                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6846                                  ; dh is head
  6847                                  ; dl is drive
  6848                                  
  6849                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6850                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6851                                  
  6852                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6853                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6854                                  
  6855 00001CA2 0E                      		push	cs
  6856 00001CA3 07                      		pop	es
  6857 00001CA4 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6858                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6859                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6860 00001CA7 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6861 00001CAA CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6862                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6863                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6864                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6865                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6866 00001CAC 7303                    		jnc	short set3_read_ok
  6867                                  set3_err:
  6868 00001CAE E9E101                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6869                                  
  6870                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6871                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6872                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6873                                  
  6874                                  set3_read_ok:
  6875                                  		; 11/08/2023
  6876                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  6877                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6878                                  		; 18/12/2023
  6879                                  		;push	bx ; +
  6880                                  		;push	ax ; (not necessary)
  6881                                  
  6882                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6883                                  		;cmp	word [bx+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6884                                  		;jne	short invalid_boot_record
  6885                                  
  6886                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6887                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  6888 00001CB1 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  6889                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6890 00001CB4 740B                    		je	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6891 00001CB6 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  6892                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6893 00001CB9 7523                    		jne	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6894 00001CBB 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  6895                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6896 00001CBF 751D                    		jne	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  6897                                  check_1_ok:
  6898                                  
  6899                                  ; 18/12/2023
  6900                                  %if 0	
  6901                                  		; 14/08/2023			
  6902                                  		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6903                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6904                                  					; point	to the bpb in the boot record
  6905                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6906                                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 14/08/2023 
  6907                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6908                                  		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6909                                  		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6910                                  		jne	short invalid_boot_record ; no,	invalid	boot record
  6911                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6912                                  		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 14/08/2023
  6913                                  		jne	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6914                                  
  6915                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6916                                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 14/08/2023
  6917                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6918                                  					; the sectorspercluster	is
  6919                                  					; a power of 2
  6920                                  					;
  6921                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6922                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6923                                  %endif
  6924                                  		; 18/12/2023
  6925                                  		; bx = disksector
  6926 00001CC1 8A4715                  		mov	al, [bx+21]	; [bx+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6927                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6928 00001CC4 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6929 00001CC6 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6930 00001CC8 7514                    		jne	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  6931 00001CCA 817F0B0002              		cmp	word [bx+11], 512 ; [bx+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6932 00001CCF 750D                    		jne	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6933                                  
  6934                                  check2_ok:	; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6935 00001CD1 8A470D                  		mov	al, [bx+13]	; now make sure that
  6936                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  6937                                  					; a power of 2
  6938                                  					;
  6939                                  					; [bx++EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6940                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6941                                  
  6942 00001CD4 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it	zero?
  6943 00001CD6 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6944                                  
  6945                                  ck_power_of_two:			
  6946 00001CD8 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift	until first bit	emerges
  6947 00001CDA 73FC                    		jnc	short ck_power_of_two
  6948 00001CDC 7406                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6949                                  
  6950                                  invalid_boot_record:
  6951                                  		; 18/12/2023
  6952                                  		;pop	ax
  6953                                  		;pop	bx ; +
  6954 00001CDE E9FE00                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6955                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6956                                  	; 12/08/2023
  6957                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6958                                  ; 16/12/2023
  6959                                  ;setret_brdg:
  6960                                  ;		jmp	setret
  6961                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6962                                  
  6963                                  unknown3_0_j:
  6964 00001CE1 E9FF00                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6965                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6966                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6967                                  
  6968                                  valid_boot_record:
  6969                                  		; 18/12/2023
  6970                                  		;pop	ax
  6971                                  		;pop	bx ; +
  6972                                  		
  6973                                  		; 18/12/2023
  6974                                  		; bx = offset disksector ; +
  6975                                  
  6976                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6977                                  
  6978                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6979 00001CE4 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'
  6980                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6981                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'

  7456 00001E3A B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  7457 00001E3C 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)

  7460 00001E42 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx

  7463 00001E48 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1

  7472                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  7473                                  		; 27/09/2022
  7474                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  7475                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)

  7477                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  7478                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  7479                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32)
  7480                                  		;   TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2;
  7481                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  7482                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  7483                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  7484                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  7485                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  7486                                  		;} else {
  7487                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz);
  7488                                  		;/* there is no BPB_FATSz32 in a FAT16 BPB */
  7489                                  		;}

  7492 00001E55 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  7493 00001E58 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  7494 00001E5B 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  7495                                  
  7496                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.

  7699                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7700                                  
  7701                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  7702                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  7703                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  7704                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.
  7705                                  ;
  7706                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
  7707                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
  7708                                  
  7709                                  setdrvparms:
  7710                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7711                                  		; ds = cs
  7712 00001EC9 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx

  7719 00001ED5 80FB05                  		cmp	bl, 5		; ffHardFile
  7720 00001ED8 753E                    		jnz	short nothardff
  7721 00001EDA 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx

  7723 00001EE0 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  7724 00001EE2 7508                    		jnz	short get_ccyl
  7725 00001EE4 268B551D                		mov	dx, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  7726 00001EE8 268B451B                		mov	ax, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  7727

  7729 00001EEC 52                      		push	dx
  7730 00001EED 50                      		push	ax
  7731 00001EEE 268B4515                		mov	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
  7732 00001EF2 26F76513                		mul	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
  7733                                  					; assume sectors per cyl. < 64k.
  7734 00001EF6 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax		; cx has # sectors per cylinder
  7735 00001EF8 58                      		pop	ax
  7736 00001EF9 5A                      		pop	dx		; dx:ax	= total	sectors
  7737 00001EFA 50                      		push	ax

  7770                                  		; 17/10/2022 (ds=cs)
  7771 00001F1A 803E[9115]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  7772                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  7773 00001F1F 7454                    		jz	short go_to_next_bds
  7774 00001F21 80FB07                  		cmp	bl, 7		; ffother
  7775                                  					; special case "other" type of medium
  7776 00001F24 753D                    		jnz	short not_process_other
  7777                                  process_other:
  7778 00001F26 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7779 00001F28 8B4525                  		mov	ax, [di+25h]	; [di+BDS.cylinders]
  7780 00001F2B F76536                  		mul	word [di+36h]	; [di+BDS.rheads]
  7781 00001F2E F76534                  		mul	word [di+34h]	; [di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
  7782 00001F31 89452F                  		mov	[di+2Fh], ax	; [di+BDS.rtotalsecs16]
  7783                                  					; have the total number of sectors
  7784 00001F34 48                      		dec	ax
