 14692                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14693                                  
 14694                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14695                                  
 14696                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14697                                  ;
 14698                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14699                                  ;
 14700                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14701                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14702                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14703                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14704                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14705                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14706                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14707                                  ;
 14708                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14709                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14710                                  ;
 14711                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14712                                  
 14713                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14714                                  HMAPtr:
 14715 0000140C 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14716                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14717 00001411 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14718                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14719 00001415 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14720 00001418 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14721 0000141A 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14722                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14723 0000141F 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14724 00001421 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14725                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14726 00001425 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14727                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14728                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14729 00001429 C3                      		retn
 14730                                  
 14731                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14732                                  
 14733                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14734                                  
 14735                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14736                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14737                                  
 14738                                  move_sector:
 14739                                  
 14740                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14741                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14742                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14743                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14744                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14745                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14746                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14747                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14748                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14749                                  ;
 14750                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14751                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14752                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14753                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14754                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14755                                  
 14756 0000142A FC                      		cld
 14757 0000142B 51                      		push	cx
 14758 0000142C B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14759 0000142F 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14760 00001433 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14761 00001435 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14762 00001439 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14763 0000143B F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14764 0000143D 59                      		pop	cx
 14765 0000143E C3                      		retn
 14766                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14767                                  
 14768                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14769 0000143F D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14770 00001441 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14771 00001443 59                      		pop	cx
 14772 00001444 C3                      		retn
 14773                                  
 14774                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14775                                  
 14776                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14777                                  
 14778                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14779                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14780                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14781                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14782                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14783                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14784                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14785                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14786                                  ;
 14787                                  ; input conditions:
 14788                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14789                                  ;
 14790                                  ; output:
 14791                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14792                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14793                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14794                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14795                                  
 14796                                  check_wrap:	
 14797 00001445 50                      		push	ax
 14798 00001446 53                      		push	bx
 14799 00001447 06                      		push	es
 14800 00001448 57                      		push	di
 14801 00001449 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14802 0000144C 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14803                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14804 0000144E 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14805                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14806 00001453 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14807 00001455 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14808 00001459 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14809 0000145B 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14810 0000145E 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14811 00001460 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14812 00001462 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14813                                  
 14814                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14815                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14816                                  
 14817 00001464 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14818 00001466 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14819                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14820 00001468 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14821 00001469 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14822                                  					; if on	boundary
 14823                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14824                                  not_on_bound:
 14825 0000146B 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14826 0000146E 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14827 00001470 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14828 00001472 40                      		inc	ax
 14829 00001473 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14830 00001475 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14831                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14832 00001478 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14833 0000147C 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14834                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14835                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14836 0000147E 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14837 00001480 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14838 00001481 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14839                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14840 00001483 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14841                                  
 14842                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14843                                  
 14844 00001485 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14845 00001487 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14846 00001489 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14847                                  
 14848                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14849                                  
 14850 0000148B 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14851 0000148D 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14852 0000148F 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14853                                  no_head_bound:				
 14854 00001490 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14855 00001492 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14856 00001493 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14857 00001495 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14858 00001497 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14859 00001499 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14860 0000149C B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14861 0000149E 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14862 000014A0 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14863 000014A2 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14864 000014A4 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14865 000014A6 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14866 000014A8 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14867 000014AA 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14868                                  no_wrap:				
 14869 000014AC F8                      		clc
 14870 000014AD 5F                      		pop	di
 14871 000014AE 07                      		pop	es
 14872 000014AF 5B                      		pop	bx
 14873 000014B0 58                      		pop	ax
 14874 000014B1 C3                      		retn
 14875                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14876                                  
 14877                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14878 000014B2 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14879 000014B4 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14880 000014B6 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14881                                  
 14882                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14883                                  
 14884                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14885                                  
 14886                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14887                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14888                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14889                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14890                                  ;
 14891                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14892                                  
 14893                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14894                                  find_bds:	
 14895 000014B8 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14896                                  fbds_1:					
 14897 000014BC 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14898 000014C0 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14899 000014C2 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14900                                  					; go to next bds
 14901 000014C5 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14902 000014C8 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14903 000014CA F9                      		stc
 14904                                  fdbs_2:					
 14905 000014CB C3                      		retn
 14906                                  
 14907                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14908                                  
 14909                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14910                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14911                                  doint:
 14912                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14913 000014CC 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14914                                  					; get physical drive number
 14915                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14916                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14917                                  		
 14918 000014CF 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14919 000014D1 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14920 000014D3 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14921                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14922 000014D5 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14923                                  					; get request code
 14924                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14925 000014D8 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14926                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14927 000014DB 9D                      		popf
 14928                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14929                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14930 000014DC 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14931                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14932                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14933 000014E1 9C                      		pushf
 14934                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14935 000014E2 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14936                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14937                                  dointdone:				
 14938 000014E5 C3                      		retn
 14939                                  
 14940                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14941                                  
 14942                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14943                                  
 14944                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14945                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14946                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14947                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14948                                  ;
 14949                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14950                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14951                                  ;
 14952                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14953                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14954                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14955                                  
 14956                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14957                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14958                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14959                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14960                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14961                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14962                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14963                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14964                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14965                                  ;end struc
 14966                                  
 14967                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14968                                  
 14969                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14970                                  ;	ah = function
 14971                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14972                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14973                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14974                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14975                                  ;   output conditions:
 14976                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14977                                  
 14978                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14979                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14980                                  ;
 14981                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14982                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14983                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14984                                  
 14985                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14986                                  
 14987                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14988                                  
 14989 000014E6 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14990                                  
 14991                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14992                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14993                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14994                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14995                                  
 14996                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14997                                  
 14998                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14999                                  
 15000                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 15001                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 15002                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 15003                                  
 15004                                  format_special_stuff:
 15005 000014EA 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 15006 000014EF 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 15007 000014F1 53                      		push	bx
 15008 000014F2 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 15009 000014F5 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 15010 000014F8 5B                      		pop	bx
 15011 000014F9 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 15012                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15013                                  
 15014                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15015                                  
 15016                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 15017                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 15018                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 15019                                  
 15020                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15021                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 15022 000014FB 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 15023 000014FD 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 15024 000014FF 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 15025 00001500 51                      		push	cx
 15026 00001501 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 15027 00001503 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 15028 00001505 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 15029 00001507 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 15030 0000150B 59                      		pop	cx
 15031 0000150C 58                      		pop	ax
 15032 0000150D 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15033                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 15034 0000150F 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 15035 00001510 06                      		push	es
 15036                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15037 00001511 2EC41E[E614]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 15038                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 15039                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 15040 00001516 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 15041 00001518 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 15042 0000151B 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 15043                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 15044                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 15045 0000151F 07                      		pop	es
 15046 00001520 5B                      		pop	bx
 15047 00001521 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15048                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15049                                  
 15050                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15051                                  
 15052                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 15053                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 15054                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 15055                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 15056                                  
 15057                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 15058 00001523 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 15059                                  					; read driver parm ?
 15060 00001528 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 15061 0000152A 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 15062                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 15063 0000152F 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15064                                  ps2_30_problem:
 15065 00001531 50                      		push	ax
 15066 00001532 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 15067                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 15068                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15069 00001534 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15070                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 15071                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15072 00001539 58                      		pop	ax
 15073 0000153A EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15074                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15075                                  
 15076                                  ; 17/10/2022
 15077                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15078                                  
 15079                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 15080                                  
 15081                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 15082                                  
 15083                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 15084                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 15085                                  
 15086                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15087 0000153C 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 15088                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 15089                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 15090 0000153D 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 15091                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 15092                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 15093                                  
 15094                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 15095                                  
 15096 00001542 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 15097 00001545 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15098 00001548 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 15099                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 15100                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 15101 0000154A 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 15102 0000154F 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 15103                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 15104                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 15105                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 15106 00001551 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15107                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15108                                  		
 15109 00001556 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 15110                                  		
 15111 00001557 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 15112                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 15113 0000155C 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 15114                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 15115                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 15116 0000155E 9D                      		popf
 15117 0000155F 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 15118                                  ret_from_i13:
 15119 00001561 1F                      		pop	ds
 15120 00001562 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 15121                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15122                                  
 15123                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 15124                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 15125                                  ; a changeline error.
 15126                                  
 15127                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 15128 00001565 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 15129                                  i13_ret_error:				
 15130 00001567 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 15131 0000156A 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 15132 0000156C 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 15133 0000156E 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 15134 00001570 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 15135 00001575 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 15136                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 15137                                  					; never	would
 15138 00001577 53                      		push	bx
 15139 00001578 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 15140 0000157B E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 15141 0000157E 5B                      		pop	bx
 15142                                  int13b:
 15143 0000157F F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 15144 00001580 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 15145                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15146                                  
 15147                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 15148                                  
 15149                                  goterr13:
 15150 00001582 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 15151 00001585 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 15152                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 15153 00001587 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 15154 0000158A 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 15155 0000158C 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 15156 00001591 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 15157                                  
 15158 00001593 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 15159                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 15160                                  					; (2 = romread)
 15161                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 15162 00001598 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 15163                                  
 15164 0000159A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 15165                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 15166                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15167 0000159C 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15168                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15169                                  					; call far 70:797h
 15170 000015A1 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 15171 000015A4 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 15172 000015A6 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 15173 000015A8 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 15174 000015AA 53                      		push	bx
 15175 000015AB 51                      		push	cx
 15176 000015AC 52                      		push	dx
 15177 000015AD A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 15178                                  loop_ecc:
 15179 000015B0 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15180                                  
 15181                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 15182                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 15183                                  ;
 15184                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 15185                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 15186                                  ; track.
 15187                                  ;
 15188                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 15189                                  ; this request.
 15190                                  ;
 15191                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 15192                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 15193                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 15194                                  ;
 15195 000015B3 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 15196                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 15197                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15198 000015B6 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15199                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15200 000015BB 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 15201 000015BD 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 15202 000015C0 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 15203 000015C2 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 15204 000015C5 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 15205                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15206                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 15207                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 15208 000015C7 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 15209                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 15210                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 15211                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 15212                                  ok11_op:
 15213 000015C9 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 15214 000015CD 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 15215 000015CF FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 15216                                  					; add 200h to address
 15217 000015D1 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15218 000015D3 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15219 000015D5 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 15220                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15221                                  
 15222                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 15223                                  
 15224                                  ok11_exit_err:
 15225 000015D7 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 15226                                  ok11_exit:
 15227 000015D8 5A                      		pop	dx
 15228 000015D9 59                      		pop	cx
 15229 000015DA 5B                      		pop	bx
 15230 000015DB EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15231                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15232                                  
 15233                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 15234                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 15235                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 15236                                  
 15237                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 15238 000015DD 06                      		push	es
 15239 000015DE 53                      		push	bx
 15240 000015DF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15241 000015E2 1E                      		push	ds
 15242 000015E3 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 15243 000015E4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15244                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 15245                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15246 000015E7 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15247                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15248 000015EC 5B                      		pop	bx
 15249 000015ED 07                      		pop	es
 15250 000015EE 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 15251 000015F0 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 15252 000015F3 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 15253                                  
 15254                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 15255                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 15256                                  
 15257                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 15258 000015F5 56                      		push	si
 15259 000015F6 57                      		push	di
 15260 000015F7 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15261 000015F9 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15262 000015FC E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 15263 000015FF 5F                      		pop	di
 15264 00001600 5E                      		pop	si
 15265 00001601 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 15266                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15267                                  
 15268                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 15269                                  ; operation as best we can.
 15270                                  
 15271                                  gotdmaerr:
 15272 00001603 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 15273 00001606 FB                      		sti
 15274 00001607 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 15275 0000160A 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15276                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 15277                                  					; functions we don't handle
 15278 0000160C 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 15279 0000160F 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 15280 00001611 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15281 00001614 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 15282 00001616 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15283                                  
 15284                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 15285                                  
 15286                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 15287                                  
 15288 00001618 52                      		push	dx
 15289 00001619 51                      		push	cx
 15290 0000161A 53                      		push	bx
 15291 0000161B 50                      		push	ax
 15292 0000161C 55                      		push	bp
 15293 0000161D 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 15294 0000161F 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 15295 00001621 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15296 00001623 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15297 00001625 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15298 00001627 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 15299 00001629 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 15300 0000162B 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 15301                                  
 15302                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 15303                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 15304                                  
 15305 0000162F 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 15306 00001631 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 15307                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15308                                  
 15309                                  no_skip_first:
 15310 00001634 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 15311 00001636 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 15312 00001638 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 15313                                  
 15314                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 15315                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 15316                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 15317                                  ;
 15318                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 15319                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 15320                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 15321                                  ; in error.
 15322                                  
 15323 0000163A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 15324 0000163C 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 15325                                  
 15326                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 15327                                  
 15328 0000163E 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15329                                  					; set up head number
 15330 00001641 E888FE                  		call	doint
 15331 00001644 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 15332                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15333                                  
 15334                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 15335 00001647 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 15336 00001649 F9                      		stc
 15337 0000164A E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 15338                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 15339                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15340                                  
 15341                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 15342                                  
 15343                                  intverify:
 15344 0000164D 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 15345 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
 15346 0000164F 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 15347 00001650 07                      		pop	es
 15348                                  dosimple:
 15349 00001651 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15350                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 15351                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 15352                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15353 00001654 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15354                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15355 00001659 5B                      		pop	bx
 15356 0000165A 07                      		pop	es
 15357 0000165B E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15358                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15359                                  
 15360                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 15361                                  
 15362                                  intformat:
 15363 0000165E 06                      		push	es
 15364 0000165F 53                      		push	bx
 15365 00001660 56                      		push	si
 15366 00001661 57                      		push	di
 15367 00001662 1E                      		push	ds
 15368                                  
 15369                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 15370                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 15371                                  
 15372 00001663 06                      		push	es
 15373 00001664 1E                      		push	ds
 15374 00001665 07                      		pop	es
 15375 00001666 1F                      		pop	ds
 15376 00001667 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 15377 00001669 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 15378 0000166C E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 15379 0000166F 1F                      		pop	ds
 15380 00001670 5F                      		pop	di
 15381 00001671 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 15382 00001672 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 15383                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15384                                  
 15385                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 15386                                  ; the first block.
 15387                                  ;
 15388                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 15389                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 15390                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 15391                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 15392                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 15393                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 15394                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 15395                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 15396                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 15397                                  
 15398                                  doblock:
 15399                                  
 15400                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 15401                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 15402                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 15403                                  				
 15404 00001674 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15405                                  					; get head #, drive #
 15406 00001677 51                      		push	cx
 15407 00001678 06                      		push	es
 15408 00001679 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15409                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 15410 0000167A E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 15411 0000167D 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 15412                                  		; 12/12/2022
 15413 00001681 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 15414                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 15415 00001686 5F                      		pop	di
 15416 00001687 07                      		pop	es
 15417 00001688 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 15418 0000168A 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 15419 0000168C B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 15420 0000168E 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15421                                  doblockflop:
 15422 00001690 59                      		pop	cx
 15423                                  doblockcontinue:
 15424 00001691 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 15425 00001693 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 15426 00001695 50                      		push	ax
 15427 00001696 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 15428 00001698 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 15429                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15430                                  
 15431                                  doblocklast:
 15432 0000169A 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15433 0000169C 50                      		push	ax
 15434                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 15435 0000169D E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15436 000016A0 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15437 000016A2 58                      		pop	ax
 15438 000016A3 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15439                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15440 000016A6 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15441 000016A8 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15442 000016AA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15443 000016AC 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15444 000016AE 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15445                                  					; then we are done already.
 15446 000016B0 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15447                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15448 000016B2 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15449 000016B5 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15450                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15451                                  
 15452                                  bufferx:
 15453 000016B7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15454                                  					; set up head number
 15455                                  buffer:
 15456 000016BA 53                      		push	bx
 15457 000016BB 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15458 000016BE 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15459 000016C1 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15460                                  
 15461                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15462                                  
 15463 000016C3 06                      		push	es
 15464 000016C4 1E                      		push	ds
 15465 000016C5 56                      		push	si
 15466 000016C6 57                      		push	di
 15467 000016C7 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15468 000016C8 06                      		push	es
 15469 000016C9 1F                      		pop	ds
 15470 000016CA 07                      		pop	es
 15471 000016CB BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15472 000016CE 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15473 000016CF 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15474 000016D1 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15475 000016D4 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15476                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15477 000016D5 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15478 000016D6 5E                      		pop	si
 15479 000016D7 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15480                                  
 15481                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15482                                  
 15483 000016D8 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15484                                  					; get drive number
 15485 000016DA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15486 000016DD E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15487                                  					;
 15488                                  					; ah is	function
 15489                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15490                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15491                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15492                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15493                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15494 000016E0 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15495 000016E3 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15496 000016E4 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15497 000016E6 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15498                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15499                                  
 15500                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15501                                  
 15502                                  doread:
 15503 000016E8 06                      		push	es
 15504 000016E9 53                      		push	bx
 15505 000016EA 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15506 000016EB 07                      		pop	es
 15507 000016EC BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15508 000016EF B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15509 000016F1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15510                                  					; get drive number
 15511 000016F4 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15512                                  					; ah = function
 15513                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15514                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15515                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15516 000016F7 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15517 000016FA 5B                      		pop	bx
 15518 000016FB 07                      		pop	es
 15519 000016FC 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15520 000016FE 56                      		push	si
 15521 000016FF 57                      		push	di
 15522 00001700 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15523 00001702 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15524 00001705 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15525 00001708 5F                      		pop	di
 15526 00001709 5E                      		pop	si
 15527                                  
 15528                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15529                                  
 15530                                  dotail:
 15531 0000170A 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15532 0000170B 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15533 0000170E 41                      		inc	cx
 15534 0000170F 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15535 00001712 F8                      		clc
 15536 00001713 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15537 00001715 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15538                                  
 15539                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15540                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15541                                  
 15542 00001717 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15543 0000171A E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15544 0000171D E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15545                                  
 15546                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15547                                  
 15548                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15549                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15550                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15551                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15552                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15553                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15554                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15555                                  
 15556                                  bad13:
 15557 00001720 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15558 00001722 5D                      		pop	bp
 15559 00001723 5B                      		pop	bx
 15560 00001724 5B                      		pop	bx
 15561 00001725 59                      		pop	cx
 15562 00001726 5A                      		pop	dx
 15563 00001727 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15564 00001729 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15565                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15566                                  
 15567                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 15568 0000172C E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15569                                  
 15570                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15571                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15572                                  		;db 	0
 15573                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15574                                  
 15575                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15576                                  
 15577                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15578                                  
 15579                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15580                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 15581                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15582                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15583                                  
 15584                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15585                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 15586 0000172F 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 15587 00001733 BF[7606]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 15588 00001736 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 15589 00001737 07                      		pop	es
 15590 00001738 E915EF                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 15591                                  
 15592                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15593                                  
 15594                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15595                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15596                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15597                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15598                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15599                                  
 15600                                  install_bds:
 15601 0000173B 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15602 0000173C BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15603                                  
 15604                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15605                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15606                                  loop_next_bds:
 15607 0000173F C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15608                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15609 00001741 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15610 00001745 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15611                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15612 00001748 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15613 0000174A B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15614 0000174C 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15615                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15616 00001750 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15617 00001753 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15618                                  					; we don't own it
 15619 00001758 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15620                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15621 0000175B 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15622 0000175E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15623                                  next_bds:
 15624                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15625 00001762 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15626 00001765 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15627                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15628                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15629 00001767 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 15630 00001769 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 15631                                  					; install bds
 15632 0000176C 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 15633 0000176E 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15634                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15635                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15636 00001771 1F                      		pop	ds
 15637                                  
 15638                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 15639                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 15640                                  
 15641                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 15642                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 15643                                  
 15644                                  		; 01/06/2019
 15645 00001772 268A4534                		mov	al,[es:di+52]
 15646                                  		; 22/07/2023
 15647                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 15648 00001776 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al,[eot]
 15649 0000177A 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 15650 0000177C A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot],al
 15651                                  _eot_ok:
 15652 0000177F C3                      		retn
 15653                                  
 15654                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15655                                  
 15656                                  ; 17/10/2022

 15672 00001780 F606[6608]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 15673                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 15674 00001785 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus

 15681                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus

 15684 0000178D 52                      		push	dx
 15685 0000178E 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 15686                                  					; get the drive	letter
 15687                                  
 15688                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 15689                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa

 15691 00001792 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 15692 00001794 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 15693 00001797 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 15694 00001799 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 15695                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 15696                                  					; Broadcast it

 15699 0000179F 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 15700                                  
 15701                                  ; using a different drive in a one drive system so request the user change disks
 15702

 15704                                  		; 17/10/2022

 15716                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 15717                                  wrmsg_loop:				
 15718 000017AF CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
 15719                                  					; AL = character to display
