 21480                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 21481                                  
 21482                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 21483                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21484                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 21485                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 21486                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 21487                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 21488                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 21489                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 21490                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 21491                                  ;								      ;I070
 21492                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 21493                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 21494                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 21495                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 21496                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 21497                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 21498                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 21499                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 21500                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 21501                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 21502                                  ;								      ;I070
 21503                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 21504                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21505                                  
 21506                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21507                                  	; ds = cs
 21508                                  
 21509                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21510                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 21511                                  
 21512 00000BC2 06                      	push	es

 21514 00000BC5 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 21515 00000BC7 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 21516 00000BC9 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 21517 00000BCB B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21518 00000BCD D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl

 21763                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.

 21818                                  ;	(ds:si) = Next DPB (-1 if none)

 21820                                  normcds:
 21821                                  	; 30/12/2023
 21822                                  	;pop	cx
 21823                                  
 21824                                  ;	if a non-fat based media is detected (by dpb.numberoffat == 0), then
 21825                                  ;	set curdir_flags to 0. this is for signaling ibmdos and ifsfunc that

 22572                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 22573                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 22574                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 22575                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 22576                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 22577                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 22578                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 22579                                  ;
 22580                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 22581                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 22582                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 22583                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 22584                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 22585                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 22586                                  ;
 22587                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 22588                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 22589                                  ;
 22590                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 22591                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 22592                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 22593                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 22594                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 22595                                  ;
 22596                                  ;	for round-up machine
 22597                                  ;
 22598                                  ;			  none.
 22599                                  
 22600                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 22601                                  ;
 22602                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 22603                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 22604                                  
 22605                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22606

 22811                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22812                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22813                                  ;
 22814                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22815                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22816                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22817                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22818                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22819                                  ; program).
 22820                                  
 22821                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22822                                  
 22823                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22824                                  
 22825 000010B9 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22826                                  
 22827                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22828                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22829                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22830                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22831                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22832                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22833                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22834                                  ; carridge return.
 22835                                  
 22836                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22837                                  ;character after =.
 22838                                  
 22839 000010BA 06                      	push	es
 22840 000010BB 1E                      	push	ds
 22841 000010BC 07                      	pop	es
 22842 000010BD 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22843 000010BE 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22844                                  
 22845 000010C0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22846 000010C2 FC                      	cld
 22847 000010C3 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22848 000010C9 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 22849                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 22850 000010CC AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 22851                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22852 000010CD 08C0                    	or	al,al
 22853                                  	;cmp	al,0
 22854 000010CF 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 22855 000010D1 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 22856                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 22857 000010D3 AC                      	lodsb
 22858 000010D4 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 22859 000010D7 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 22860 000010D9 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 22861 000010DB FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 22862 000010DD 47                      	inc	di
 22863 000010DE EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 22864                                  done_installparm:
 22865 000010E0 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 22866                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22867 000010E5 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 22868                                  	;cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 22869 000010E7 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 22870 000010E9 2EC606[F102]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 22871                                  					; starts with cr.
 22872                                  install_seg_set:
 22873                                  	; 05/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 22874 000010EF 31DB                    	xor	bx, bx

 22877 000010F4 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 22980                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22981                                  
 22982                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22983                                  ;
 22984                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22985                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22986                                  ;
 22987                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22988                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22989                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22990                                  
 22991                                  ParaRound:
 22992 00001137 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22993 0000113A D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22994 0000113C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22995 0000113E D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22996 00001140 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22997 00001142 C3                      	retn
 22998                                  
 22999                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23000                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 23001                                  ;
 23002                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 23003                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 23004                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 23005                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 23006                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 23007                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 23008                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 23009                                  ;
 23010                                  ;in: after relocation,
 23011                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 23012                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 23013                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 23014                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 23015                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 23016                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 23017                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 23018                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 23019                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 23020                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 23021                                  ;
 23022                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 23023                                  
 23024                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23025                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23026                                  sysinit_base:				
 23027 00001143 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 23028 00001148 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 23029 0000114D CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 23030 0000114F 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 23031 00001154 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 23032 00001159 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 23033 0000115A 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 23034 0000115B 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 23035                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 23036                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 23037 0000115D E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 23038 00001160 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 23039 00001165 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 23040                                  
 23041                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 23042                                  
 23043 00001167 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 23044 00001169 0E                      	push	cs
 23045 0000116A 1F                      	pop	ds
 23046                                  	; 30/12/2022
 23047                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 23048                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 23049 0000116B BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23050                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 23051 0000116E CD21                    	int	21h
 23052                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 23053                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 23054                                  
 23055                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23056                                  stall:
 23057                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23058                                  _stall: 
 23059                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23060 00001170 F4                      	hlt 
 23061                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23062                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 23063 00001171 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 23064                                  
 23065                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 23066 00001173 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 23067                                  
 23068                                  ;-------------------------------------
 23069                                  
 23070                                  sum_up:
 23071                                  
 23072                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 23073                                  ;out:  ax - result
 23074                                  ;
 23075                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 23076                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 23077                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 23078                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 23079                                  ;
 23080                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 23081                                  
 23082 00001178 1E                      	push	ds
 23083                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 23084                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 23085 00001179 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 23086                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23087                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 23088 0000117D 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 23089 0000117F 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 23090 00001181 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23091 00001183 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 23092                                  					; whole test better fail.
 23093 00001188 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 23094 0000118A 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 23095                                  sum1:
 23096 0000118C 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 23097 0000118E 46                      	inc	si
 23098 0000118F 46                      	inc	si
 23099 00001190 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 23100                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 23101                                  sum_sys_code:
 23102                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23103 00001192 BE9211                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23104                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23105                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 23106                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 23107                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 23108                                  	; 02/11/2022
 23109                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 23110                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 23111 00001195 B9[604D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 23112 00001198 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 23113 0000119A D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 23114                                  sum2:
 23115 0000119C 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 23116 0000119F 46                      	inc	si
 23117 000011A0 46                      	inc	si
 23118 000011A1 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 23119 000011A3 1F                      	pop	ds
 23120 000011A4 C3                      	retn
 23121                                  
 23122                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23123                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23124                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 23125                                  
 23126                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)

 23128 000011A5 0000                    	dw	0

 23143                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23144                                  
 23145                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23146                                  ; Set_Buffer
 23147                                  ;
 23148                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 23149                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 23150                                  ;
 23151                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 23152                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 23153                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 23154                                  ;
 23155                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 23156                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 23157                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23158                                  
 23159                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23160                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 23161                                  
 23162                                  set_buffer:
 23163 000011C4 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 23164 000011C6 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 23165 000011C9 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 23166                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 23167                                  	; 17/09/2023
 23168 000011CB FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 23169                                  set_buff_1:
 23170                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23171                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 23172 000011CD 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 23173                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 23174 000011CF 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 23175                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 23176 000011D2 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 23177                                  
 23178 000011D7 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 23179 000011D9 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 23180 000011DE 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 23181                                  
 23182                                  ;	for each buffer
 23183                                  
 23184                                  nxt_buff:
 23185 000011DF E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 23186 000011E2 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 23187 000011E4 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 23188                                  
 23189 000011E6 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 23190                                  
 23191 000011EB 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 23192                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 23193 000011EC 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 23194 000011EF 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 23195                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 23196                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23197 000011F1 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 23198                                  
 23199 000011F5 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 23200 000011F7 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 23201                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 23202 000011F9 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 23203 000011FD 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 23204                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 23205 00001201 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 23206                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 23207 00001206 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 23208 00001209 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 23209                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 23210                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 23211 0000120D 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 23212                                  set_buff_2:
 23213 00001210 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 23214                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 23215 00001215 2E800E[A914]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 23216                                  	;call	round
 23217                                  	;retn
 23218                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23219 0000121B E93D30                  	jmp	round
 23220                                  
 23221                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23222                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 23223                                  ;
 23224                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 23225                                  ;
 23226                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 23227                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 23228                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23229                                  
 23230                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23231                                  GetBufferAddr:
 23232 0000121E 53                      	push	bx
 23233 0000121F 52                      	push	dx
 23234 00001220 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 23235 00001224 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 23236                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 23237 00001229 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 23238                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23239                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 23240                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23241 0000122C 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 23242 0000122E 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23243 00001230 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 23244                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 23245 00001233 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 23246 00001235 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 23247 00001238 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 23248                                  	
 23249                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 23250                                  	; 05/09/2023
 23251                                  	; zf=1
 23252 0000123A 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 23253                                  	; zf=1
 23254                                  	
 23255                                  	;zf=1
 23256                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 23257                                  	;zf=1
 23258 0000123B 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 23259                                  got_hma:
 23260 00001240 5A                      	pop	dx
 23261 00001241 5B                      	pop	bx
 23262 00001242 C3                      	retn
 23263                                  
 23264                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23265                                  
 23266                                  set_buffer_info:
 23267                                  
 23268                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 23269                                  ;
 23270                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 23271                                  ;    ax = di
 23272                                  ;
 23273                                  ;out:
 23274                                  ;    above entries set.
 23275                                  
 23276                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23277 00001243 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 23278                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 23279 00001248 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 23280 0000124C 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 23281 00001250 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 23282                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 23283 00001255 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 23284                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 23285 00001258 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 23286                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23287 0000125E 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 23288                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23289 00001264 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 23290 0000126A C3                      	retn
 23291                                  
 23292                                  ; ======================================================================
 23293                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 23294                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23295                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23296                                  
 23297                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23298                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 23299                                  ;
 23300                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 23301                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 23302                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 23303                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 23304                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 23305                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 23306                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 23307                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 23308                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 23309                                  ;
 23310                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 23311                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 23312                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 23313                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 23314                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 23315                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 23316                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 23317                                  ;	conditions:
 23318                                  ;
 23319                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 23320                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 23321                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 23322                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 23323                                  ;
 23324                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 23325                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 23326                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 23327                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 23328                                  ;
 23329                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 23330                                  ;
 23331                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 23332                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 23333                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 23334                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 23335                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 23336                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 23337                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 23338                                  ;	interrupt line.
 23339                                  ;
 23340                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 23341                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 23342                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 23343                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 23344                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 23345                                  ;
 23346                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 23347                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 23348                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 23349                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 23350                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 23351                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 23352                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 23353                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 23354                                  ;
 23355                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 23356                                  
 23357                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23358                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 23359                                  
 23360                                  	; 14/12/2022
 23361                                  stackinit:
 23362 0000126B 50                      	push	ax
 23363 0000126C 1E                      	push	ds
 23364 0000126D 06                      	push	es
 23365 0000126E 53                      	push	bx
 23366 0000126F 51                      	push	cx
 23367 00001270 52                      	push	dx
 23368 00001271 57                      	push	di
 23369 00001272 56                      	push	si
 23370 00001273 55                      	push	bp
 23371                                  
 23372                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 23373                                  
 23374                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23375                                  	; ds = cs
 23376 00001274 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 23377 00001277 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 23378                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23379                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 23380                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 23381 00001279 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 23382                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 23383 0000127D A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 23384 00001280 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 23385                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23386 00001284 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 23387                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23388                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 23389                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 23390 00001287 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 23391                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23392 0000128B 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 23393 0000128D A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 23394                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23395                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 23396                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 23397 00001290 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 23398                                  
 23399                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 23400                                  
 23401                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 23402                                  
 23403                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 23404                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23405                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*

 23407                                  
 23408                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 23409                                  
 23410 00001299 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8

 23413                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*

 23415 0000129E 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 23416 000012A0 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 23417 000012A4 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23418 000012A6 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 23419                                  
 23420                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 23421                                  
 23422 000012A9 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 23423 000012AE 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 23424 000012B2 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 23425 000012B4 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 23426 000012B6 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23427 000012B8 06                      	push	es
 23428 000012B9 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 23429                                  
 23430                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 23431                                  
 23432 000012BA 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 23433 000012BE FC                      	cld
 23434 000012BF F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 23435                                  
 23436 000012C1 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 23437                                  
 23438                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 23439                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 23440                                  ;  cx = number of entries

 23442                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 24203                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 24204                                  
 24205                                  new_init_loop:
 24206                                  
 24207                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 24208                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 24209                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 24210                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 24211                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 24212                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 24213                                  
 24214 0000145D 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 24215 00001460 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 24216 00001462 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 24217 00001466 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 24218                                  
 24219 00001469 1E                      	push	ds
 24220                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 24221                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 24222                                  	; 21/10/2022
 24223 0000146A B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 24224 0000146D 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 24225 0000146F 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 24226 00001472 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 24227 00001474 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 24228 00001478 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 24229 0000147B 1F                      	pop	ds
 24230                                  
 24231 0000147C 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 24232 0000147F 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 24233 00001483 C3                      	retn
 24234                                  
 24235                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 24236                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24237                                  
 24238                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24239                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 24240                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 24241                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 24242                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 24243                                  ;out: devmark established.
 24244                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 24245                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 24246                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24247                                  
 24248                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24249                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 24250                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24251                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 24252                                  
 24253                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 24254                                  
 24255                                  setdevmark:
 24256                                  
 24257                                  	; 04/09/2023
 24258                                  	;push	es
 24259                                  	;push	cx
 24260                                  
 24261 00001484 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 24262 00001489 2E890E[A714]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 24263 0000148E 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 24264                                  	; 25/10/2022
 24265                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 24266 00001490 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 24267 00001494 41                      	inc	cx
 24268                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 24269 00001495 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 24270                                  
 24271                                  	; 04/09/2023
 24272                                  	;pop	cx
 24273                                  	;pop	es
 24274                                  	
 24275 0000149A 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 24276 0000149F C3                      	retn

 24479                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 24480                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 24481                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 24482                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 24483                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 24484                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 24485                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 24486                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 24487                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 24488                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24489

 24491                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk

 24495                                  endstruc

 24501                                  
 24502                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24503                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE

 24514                                  
 24515                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 24516                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 24517 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 24518 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 24519 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 24520                                  endstruc
 24521                                  
 24522                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24523                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 24524                                  ;
 24525                                  ;
 24526                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 24527                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 24528                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24529                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24530                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24531                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24532                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24533                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24534                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24535                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24536                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24537                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 24538                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 24539                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 24540                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 24541                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 24542                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 24543                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 24544                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 24545                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 24546                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 24547                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 24548                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 24549                                  ;	   :
 24550                                  ;
 24551                                  ;Note:
 24552                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 24553                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 24554                                  ;
 24555                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 24556                                  ;
 24557                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 24558                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 24559                                  ;
 24560                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 24561                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 24562                                  ;
 24563                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 24564                                  ;
 24565                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 24566                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 24567                                  ;
 24568                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24569                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 24570                                  ;
 24571                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 24572                                  ;
 24573                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24574                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 24575                                  ;
 24576                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24577                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24578                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24579                                  ;
 24580                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 24581                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 24582                                  ;
 24583                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 24584                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 24585                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 24586                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24587                                  
 24588                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 24589                                  
 24590                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 24591                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 24592                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 24593                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 24594                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 24595                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 24596                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 24597                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 24598                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 24599                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 24600                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 24601                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 24602                                  
 24603                                  ;**** Function flags
 24604                                  
 24605                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 24606                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 24607                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 24608                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 24609                                  
 24610                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 24611                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 24612 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 24613 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 24614 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 24615 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 24616 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 24617 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 24618                                  endstruc
 24619                                  
 24620                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24621                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 24622                                  ;
 24623                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 24624                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 24625                                  ;	     +-
 24626                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 24627                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 24628                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 24629                                  ;	     |	:
 24630                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24631                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 24632                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 24633                                  ;	     |	:
 24634                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24635                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 24636                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 24637                                  ;	     +-	:
 24638                                  ;
 24639                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 24640                                  ;
 24641                                  ;Note:
 24642                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 24643                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 24644                                  ;
 24645                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24646                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24647                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24648                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24649                                  
 24650                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 24651                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 24652                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 24653                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 24654                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 24655                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 24656                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 24657                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 24658                                  
 24659                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 24660 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 24661 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 24662 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 24663 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 24664 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 24665                                  endstruc
 24666                                  
 24667                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24668                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 24669                                  ;
 24670                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 24671                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 24672                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 24673                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 24674                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24675                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24676                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24677                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24678                                  ;
 24679                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24680                                  ;
 24681                                  ;            +-
 24682                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24683                                  ;	    | or
 24684                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24685                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24686                                  ;	    | or
 24687                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24688                                  ;	    | or
 24689                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24690                                  ;	    | or
 24691                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24692                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24693                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24694                                  ;	    | or
 24695                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24696                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24697                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24698                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24699                                  ;	    +-
 24700                                  ;
 24701                                  ;
 24702                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24703                                  ;      list.
 24704                                  ;
 24705                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24706                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24707                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24708                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24709

 24714 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24715 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24716                                  endstruc

 24833                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24834                                  ; SysParse;
 24835                                  ;
 24836                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24837                                  ;
 24838                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24839                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24840                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24841                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24842                                  ;
 24843                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24844                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24845                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24846                                  ;
 24847                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24848                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24849                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24850                                  ;
 24851                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24852                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24853                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24854                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24855                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24856                                  ;
 24857                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24858                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24859                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24860                                  ;
 24861                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24862                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24863                                  ;

 24865                                  ;

 24914                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow

 24919                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24920                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24921                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24922                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control

 25054                                  ;M029 -- Begin changes
 25055                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 25056                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 25057                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 25058                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 25059                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 25060                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 25061                                  
 25062                                  ;IF FileSW + DrvSW
 25063                                  	;mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char], ']['

 25530                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25531                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 25532                                  ;
 25533                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 25534                                  ;
 25535                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 25536                                  ;	    AL = type
 25537                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 25538                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 25539                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 25540                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 25541                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 25542                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 25543                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 25544                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25545                                  ;
 25546                                  ; Output:   None
 25547                                  ;
 25548                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 25549                                  ;
 25550                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 25551                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25552                                  
 25553                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 25563

 25947                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25948                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25949                                  ;
 25950                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25951                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25952                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25953                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25954                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25955                                  ;
 25956                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25957                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25958                                  ;
 25959                                  ; Output:    None
 25960                                  ;
 25961                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25962                                  ;
 25963                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25964                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25965                                  
 25966                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25967                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25968                                  
 25969                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25970                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25971                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25972 00001916 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25973 00001917 2E800E[BD14]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25974 0000191D 2E8026[BD14]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25975                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25976 00001923 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25977 00001926 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25978 00001928 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25979                                  
 25980 0000192A 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25981 0000192C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25982                                  
 25983 0000192E 2E800E[BD14]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25984                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25985 00001934 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25986                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25987 00001935 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25988 00001938 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25989 00001939 C3                      	retn

 26901                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26902                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26903                                  ;
 26904                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26905                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26906                                  ;	    blanks.
 26907                                  ;
 26908                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26909                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26910                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26911                                  ;
 26912                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26913                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26914                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26915                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26916                                  
 26917                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26918                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26919                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26920                                  
 26921                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26922 00001C5C 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26923 00001C5D 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26924 00001C5E 2EC606[B714]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26925                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26926                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26927 00001C64 2E8026[BD14]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26928 00001C6A 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26929 00001C6C 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26930                                  
 26931 00001C6E 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26932 00001C70 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26933                                  
 26934 00001C72 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26935 00001C74 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26936                                  
 26937                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26938                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26939                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26940                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26941                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26942                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26943                                  %if 0
 26944                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26945                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26946                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26947                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26948                                  
 26949                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26950                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26951                                  
 26952                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26953                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26954                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26955                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26956                                  %endif
 26957                                  
 26958                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26959 00001C76 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26960                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26961 00001C7B 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26962                                  
 26963                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26964 00001C7D 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26965                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26966 00001C7F 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26967                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26968                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26969                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26970                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26971 00001C83 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26972                                  
 26973 00001C85 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26974                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26975 00001C88 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26976 00001C89 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character

 26978

 26983                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26984                                  	; cx=0 here
 26985 00001C90 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26986                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26987                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;

 26996
