 27003                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27004                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 27005                                  ;
 27006                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 27007                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 27008                                  ;
 27009                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 27010                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 27011                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 27012                                  ;
 27013                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 27014                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 27015                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 27016                                  
 27017                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 27018                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 27019                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 27020                                  ;
 27021                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 27022                                  
 27023                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 27024                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27025                                  
 27026                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 27027                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 27028                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 27029                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27030 00001CAA BD[C614]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 27031                                  
 27032                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 27033 00001CAD 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 27034 00001CAF 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 27035                                  
 27036                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 27037 00001CB1 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27038 00001CB3 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 27039                                  
 27040 00001CB5 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 27041                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27042                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27043 00001CB6 C3                      	retn
 27044                                  
 27045                                  ; 12/12/2022
 27046                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 27047                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 27048                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 27049                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 27050                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27051                                  
 27052                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 27053                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 27054 00001CB7 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27055 00001CB9 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 27056                                  
 27057 00001CBB 2E800E[BD14]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 27058                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27059                                  
 27060                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27061                                  	; cf=0
 27062                                  	;retn
 27063                                  
 27064                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 27065                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27066                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 27067 00001CC1 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 27068                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27069                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 27070 00001CC2 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 27071                                  
 27072                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27073                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27074                                  ;
 27075                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 27076                                  ;
 27077                                  ;  Input:
 27078                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 27079                                  ;
 27080                                  ;  Output:
 27081                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 27082                                  ;
 27083                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 27084                                  ;
 27085                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 27086                                  ;***************************************************************************
 27087                                  
 27088                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27089 00001CC3 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 27090 00001CC4 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 27091 00001CC5 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27092                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 27093                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 27094                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27095 00001CC6 2E8B36[BA14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 27096 00001CCB 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 27097 00001CCD 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 27098 00001CCF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 27099 00001CD0 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27100 00001CD1 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 27101 00001CD2 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 27102 00001CD3 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 27103 00001CD4 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 27104 00001CD5 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 27105                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 27106                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 27107 00001CD6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 27108 00001CD8 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 27109 00001CDB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 27110                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 27111 00001CDD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27112 00001CDF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27113 00001CE1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 27114 00001CE2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 27115 00001CE3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 27116 00001CE4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 27117 00001CE5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 27118 00001CE6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27119 00001CE7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 27120 00001CE8 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 27121                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 27122 00001CEA 2E8936[B814]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 27123 00001CEF 2E891E[BA14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 27124                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 27125                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 27126                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 27127                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27128 00001CF4 2EC536[B814]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 27129                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 27130 00001CF9 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 27131 00001CFC 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 27132 00001CFE 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 27133 00001D00 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 27134 00001D02 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 27135 00001D05 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 27136 00001D07 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 27137 00001D08 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 27138                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 27139 00001D0A 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 27140 00001D0B 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 27141                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 27142 00001D0C EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 27143                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 27144                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27145                                  	; cf=0
 27146                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 27147                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 27148 00001D0E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27149 00001D0F 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 27150 00001D10 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 27151 00001D11 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27713                                  
 27714                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 27715                                  
 27716                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27717                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27718                                  
 27719                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27720                                  ;
 27721                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27722                                  ;
 27723                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27724                                  ;
 27725                                  ;   Modification log:
 27726                                  ;
 27727                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27728                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27729                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27730                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27731                                  ;
 27732                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27733                                  ;
 27734                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27735                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27736                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27737                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27738                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27739                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27740                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27741                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27742                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27743                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27744                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27745                                  ;
 27746                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27747                                  
 27748                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27749                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27750                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27751                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27752                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27753                                  
 27754                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27755                                  
 27756                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27757                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27758                                  
 27759                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27760                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27761                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27762                                  
 27763                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27764                                  ;
 27765                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27766                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27767                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27768                                  ;	           line.
 27769                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27770                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27771                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27772                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27773                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27774                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27775                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27776                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27777                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27778                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27779                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27780                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27781                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27782                                  ;	           for details).
 27783                                  
 27784 00001F11 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27785 00001F12 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27786 00001F13 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27787 00001F15 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27788 00001F16 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27789 00001F26 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27790 00001F46 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27791 00001F47 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27792 00001F48 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27793                                  
 27794                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27795                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27796                                  
 27797                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27798                                  
 27799                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27800                                  
 27801                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27802                                  
 27803                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 27804                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 27805                                  
 27806                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27807                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27808

 27810                                  
 27811 00001F49 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 27812 00001F4B 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27813 00001F4D 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27814 00001F4F 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27815 00001F53 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 27816                                  ; 30/12/2022
 27817                                  ; 27/10/2022

 27819                                  ;

 27821 00001F59 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 27822 00001F5B 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 27857                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27858                                  ;
 27859                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27860                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27861                                  ;

 27863

 28090                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28091                                  ;%if 0
 28092                                  
 28093                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28094                                  
 28095                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 28096                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 28097                                  
 28098 00002058 A2[A414]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 28099                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY

 28101                                  
 28102                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28103 0000205D 3826[A514]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 28104                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 28105 00002061 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 28106                                  
 28107 00002063 50                              push    ax                      ;
 28108 00002064 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 28109 00002067 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 28110 00002069 E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 28111 0000206C 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 28112 0000206E A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 28113 00002071 58                              pop     ax
 28114                                  ;
 28115                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 28116                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 28117                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 28118                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 28119                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 28120                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 28121                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 28122                                  ;   spot.
 28123                                  ;
 28124                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 28125                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 28126                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 28127                                  ;   retrieved.
 28128                                  ;
 28129 00002072 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 28130 00002077 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28131                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 28132 00002079 F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28133 0000207E 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 28134 00002080 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 28135 00002085 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28136                                  final:                                  ;
 28137 00002087 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 28138                                  not_final:                              ;
 28139                                  ;endif
 28140                                  
 28141                                  ; 31/12/2022
 28142                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28143                                  
 28144 0000208A 88C4                    	mov	ah,al

 28153                                  	
 28154                                  coff:

 28164 000020A3 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 28165                                  
 28166                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28167                                  ; 11/12/2022
 28168                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 28169                                  ;coff_p:
 28170                                  	;push	cs
 28171                                  	;pop	ds
 28172                                  
 28173                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 28174                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 28175                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 28176                                  ;install= command.
 28177                                  
 28178                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28179                                  ;install command
 28180                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28181                                  
 28182                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 28183                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 28184                                  tryi:
 28185 000020A5 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI

 28196                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 28197                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 28198                                  					; and before install= commands

 28208                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff

 28211                                  ;       but don't process them now.

 28265                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 28270                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 28271                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high

 28303                                  
 28304                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28305                                  
 28306                                  multi_pass_filter:
 28307 00002125 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?

 28309 0000212A 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?

 28313

 28315 00002134 FF0E[5A03]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count

 30063                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30064                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 30065                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 30066                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 30067                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 30068                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 30069                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 30070                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 30071                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30072                                  
 30073                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30074                                  ;									  *
 30075                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 30076                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 30077                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 30078                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 30079                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 30080                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 30081                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 30082                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 30083                                  ; input :								  *
 30084                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 30085                                  ; output:								  *
 30086                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 30087                                  ;									  *
 30088                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 30089                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 30090                                  ; logic:								  *
 30091                                  ; {									  *
 30092                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 30093                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 30094                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 30095                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 30096                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 30097                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 30098                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30099                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 30100                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30101                                  ;	     }								  *
 30102                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 30103                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 30104                                  ;	};								  *
 30105                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 30106                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 30107                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 30108                                  ; };									  *
 30109                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30859                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30860                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 30861                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 30862                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30863                                  ;
 30864                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30865                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30866                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30867                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30868                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30869                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30870                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30871                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30872                                  ;	 procedure.
 30873                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30874                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30875                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30876                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 31223                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 31224                                  ;
 31225                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 31226                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 31227                                  ;
 31228                                  ;	Output : none
 31229                                  ;
 31230                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 31231                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 31232                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31233                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 31234                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31235                                  ;
 31236                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31237                                  
 31238                                  LieInt12Mem:
 31239                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31240                                  	; ds = cs
 31241 00002975 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 31242                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 31243                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 31244 00002978 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 31245 0000297B 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 31246                                  	; 13/05/2019
 31247                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 31248                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 31249                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 31250                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31251                                  	; ds = cs
 31252 0000297D 803E[671F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 31253 00002982 74F0                    	je	short limx
 31254 00002984 A1[4D1F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 31255                                  lim_set:
 31256                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31257                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31258                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 31259                                  ;limx:
 31260                                  	;retn
 31261                                  	
 31262                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 31263                                  
 31264                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31265                                  ;
 31266                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 31267                                  ;
 31268                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 31269                                  ;	Output : none
 31270                                  ;
 31271                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 31272                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 31273                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 31274                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 31275                                  ;
 31276                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31277                                  
 31278                                  	; 01/11/2022
 31279                                  SetInt12Mem:
 31280 00002987 1E                      	push	ds
 31281 00002988 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 31282 0000298B 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 31283 0000298D 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 31284 00002991 2E891E[6B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 31285 00002996 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 31286 00002998 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 31287 0000299A A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 31288 0000299D 2EC606[6A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 31289 000029A3 1F                      	pop	ds
 31290                                  ;limx:
 31291 000029A4 C3                      	retn
 31292                                  
 31293                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31294                                  ;
 31295                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 31296                                  ;
 31297                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 31298                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 31299                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 31300                                  ;
 31301                                  ;	Output : none
 31302                                  ;
 31303                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 31304                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 31305                                  ;
 31306                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31307                                  
 31308                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 31309                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31310                                  	; ds = cs
 31311 000029A5 803E[6A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 31312                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 31313                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 31314                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 31315 000029AA 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 31316                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31317 000029AC B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 31318 000029AF 8826[6A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 31319                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 31320                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 31321 000029B3 1E                      	push	ds
 31322                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 31323 000029B4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 31324 000029B6 2EA1[6B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 31325 000029BA A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 31326 000029BD 1F                      	pop	ds
 31327                                  timx:
 31328 000029BE C3                      	retn
 31329

 31378                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31379                                  ;%if 0
 31380                                  
 31381                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31382                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31383                                  
 31384                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 31385                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 31386                                  
 31387                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31388                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 31389                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31390                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31391                                  
 31392                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31393                                  ;
 31394                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 31395                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 31396                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 31397                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 31398                                  ;
 31399                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 31400                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 31401                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 31402                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 31403                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 31404                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 31405                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 31406                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 31407                                  ; available during the load.
 31408                                  ;
 31409                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 31410                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 31411                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 31412                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 31413                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 31414                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 31415                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 31416                                  ;
 31417                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 31418                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 31419                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 31420                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 31421                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 31422                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 31423                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 31424                                  ;
 31425                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31426                                  
 31427                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 31428                                  
 31429                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 31430                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 31431                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 31432                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 31433                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 31434                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 31435                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 31436                                  
 31437                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 31438                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 31439                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 31440                                  
 31441                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31442                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 31443                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31444                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 31445                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 31446                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 31447                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31448                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31449                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 31450                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 31451                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31452                                  
 31453                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31454                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31455                                  
 31456                                  InitVar:
 31457                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31458                                  	; ds = cs
 31459                                  
 31460                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 31461                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31462                                  	;push	ax
 31463                                  	;push	cx
 31464                                  	;push	di
 31465 000029E9 06                      	push	es
 31466                                  
 31467                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 31468 000029EA 0E                      	push	cs
 31469 000029EB 07                      	pop	es
 31470                                  
 31471 000029EC 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31472                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31473                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31474                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31475                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31476                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31477                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 31478                                  
 31479                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31480                                  	; ds = cs
 31481 000029EE A2[121F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31482 000029F1 A2[111F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31483 000029F4 A3[131F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31484 000029F7 C606[151F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31485                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31486 000029FC A2[481F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 31487                                  
 31488 000029FF FC                      	cld
 31489                                  
 31490 00002A00 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 31491 00002A03 BF[161F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 31492 00002A06 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 31493                                  
 31494                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 31495                                  	; 01/01/2033
 31496 00002A08 B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 31497 00002A0A BF[261F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 31498 00002A0D F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 31499                                  
 31500                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 31501                                  
 31502                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 31503 00002A0F 07                      	pop	es
 31504                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31505                                  	;pop	di
 31506                                  	;pop	cx
 31507                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 31508                                  
 31509 00002A10 C3                      	retn
 31510                                  
 31511                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31512                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 31513                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31514                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 31515                                  ; EXIT    : None
 31516                                  ; ERROR   : None
 31517                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31518                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31519                                  
 31520                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31521                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 31522                                  FixMem:
 31523                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31524                                  	;push	ax
 31525                                  	;push	bx
 31526                                  	;push	cx
 31527                                  	;push	dx
 31528 00002A11 06                      	push	es
 31529                                  
 31530 00002A12 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 31531                                  
 31532 00002A15 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 31533 00002A18 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 31534                                  
 31535 00002A1A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 31536                                  
 31537                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 31538                                  
 31539 00002A1C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 31540 00002A1E 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 31541 00002A20 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 31542                                  
 31543                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31544                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 31545                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 31546                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31547                                  
 31548 00002A21 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 31549 00002A25 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 31550 00002A2A 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 31551 00002A2C 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 31552                                  
 31553                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 31554                                  
 31555 00002A2E 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 31556 00002A33 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 31557 00002A35 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 31558                                  
 31559 00002A39 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 31560                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 31561                                  	; 11/07/2023
 31562 00002A3E 43                      	inc	bx
 31563 00002A3F 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 31564                                  
 31565                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 31566                                  
 31567 00002A44 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 31568 00002A46 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 31569                                  
 31570 00002A4B 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 31571 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31572 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 31573 00002A53 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 31574                                  
 31575                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 31576 00002A55 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 31577 00002A57 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 31578                                  fmX:	
 31579 00002A59 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 31580                                  
 31581 00002A5C 07                      	pop	es
 31582                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31583                                  	;pop	dx
 31584                                  	;pop	cx
 31585                                  	;pop	bx
 31586                                  	;pop	ax
 31587                                  
 31588 00002A5D C3                      	retn
 31589                                  
 31590                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31591                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 31592                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31593                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31594                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 31595                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31596                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 31597                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31598                                  
 31599                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31600                                  fm_link:
 31601 00002A5E B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 31602 00002A61 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 31603                                  
 31604                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 31605                                  	;
 31606                                  	;push	es
 31607                                  	;push	cs
 31608                                  	;pop	es
 31609                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 31610                                  	;pop	es
 31611                                  	
 31612                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31613                                  	; ds = cs
 31614                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 31615 00002A63 A2[461F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 31616                                  
 31617 00002A66 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31618 00002A69 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 31619 00002A6C CD21                    	int	21h
 31620 00002A6E C3                      	retn
 31621                                  
 31622                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31623                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 31624                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31625                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 31626                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31627                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31628                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 31629                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31630                                  
 31631                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31632                                  fm_unlink:
 31633 00002A6F 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31634                                  	
 31635                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 31636                                  	;
 31637                                  	;push	ds
 31638                                  	;push	cs
 31639                                  	;pop	ds
 31640                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 31641                                  	;pop	ds
 31642                                  	
 31643                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31644                                  	; ds = cs
 31645                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 31646 00002A71 8A1E[461F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 31647                                  
 31648 00002A75 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31649 00002A78 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 31650 00002A7A C3                      	retn
 31651                                  
 31652                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31653                                  
 31654                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31655                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 31656                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 31657                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31658                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 31659                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 31660                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 31661                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31662                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31663                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 31664                                  ;
 31665                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 31666                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 31667                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31668                                  ;
 31669                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 31670                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 31671                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 31672                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 31673                                  ;
 31674                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31675                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31676                                  ;
 31677                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31678                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31679                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31680                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31681                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31682                                  ;     lh
 31683                                  ;     /l
 31684                                  ;     1
 31685                                  ;     1000
 31686                                  ;     2
 31687                                  ;     print
 31688                                  ;     /d
 31689                                  ;     :lpt2
 31690                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31691                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31692                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31693                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31694                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31695                                  ; for:
 31696                                  ;    Each /L
 31697                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31698                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31699                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31700                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31701                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31702                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31703                                  
 31704                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31705                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31706                                  
 31707                                  ParseVar:
 31708                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31709                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31710                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31711 00002A7B 1E                      	push	ds
 31712 00002A7C 06                      	push	es
 31713                                  
 31714 00002A7D 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31715 00002A7E 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31716 00002A7F FC                      	cld
 31717                                  
 31718                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31719                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31720                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31721                                  
 31722 00002A80 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31723 00002A81 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31724 00002A84 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31725                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31726 00002A86 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31727 00002A88 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31728                                  
 31729 00002A8A 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31730 00002A8B F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31731 00002A8C EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31732                                  
 31733 00002A8E AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31734                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...

 31780                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31781                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31782                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31783                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31784                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31785                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31786                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31787                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31788                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31789                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31790                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31791                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31792                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31793                                  
 31794                                  parseL:
 31795 00002ABC AC                      	lodsb
 31796 00002ABD 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31797 00002ABF 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31798                                  
 31799                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31800                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31801                                  ; ------------------------------------------

 31809 00002ACE 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31810                                  
 31811                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31812 00002AD0 2EFE06[481F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31813                                  
 31814 00002AD5 AC                      	lodsb
 31815 00002AD6 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31816 00002AD8 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31817

 31820

 31822 00002AE2 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31823

 31826 00002AE6 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31827                                  
 31828 00002AE8 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31829 00002AEA 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31830

 31832                                  
 31833 00002AEC E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31834 00002AEF 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31835

 31837

 31839                                  
 31840                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31841 00002AF7 2EFE06[481F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31842                                  
 31843 00002AFC AC                      	lodsb
 31844 00002AFD 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31845 00002AFF 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31846

 31848 00002B04 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.

 31852

 31855 00002B0D 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31856                                  plE1:

 31902                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31903                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31904                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31905                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31906                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31907                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31908                                  ; USES:     ZF

 31913 00002B1D 7406                    	je	short ieX

 31915 00002B21 7402                    	je	short ieX

 31924                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals

 31935                                  iwX:

 31989                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31990                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31991                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31992                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31993                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31994                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31995                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31996                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31997                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31998                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31999                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32000                                  
 32001                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32002                                  stowUMB:

 32014                                  	;push	cs

 32016                                  	;push	cs
 32017                                  	;pop	ds

 32019                                  	; 01/01/2023

 32022 00002B4A 2E803E[151F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 32023                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 32024 00002B50 7504                    	jne	short su20
 32025 00002B52 2EA2[151F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 32026

 32028                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 32029                                  	;jne	short su20

 32031                                  su20:

 32048                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
