 36863                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36864                                  ;
 36865                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 36866                                  ;
 36867                                  ;   INPUT
 36868                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 36869                                  ;
 36870                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36871                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 36872                                  ;
 36873                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36874                                  ;       All
 36875                                  ;
 36876                                  ;   HISTORY
 36877                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 36878                                  ;
 36879                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36880                                  
 36881                                  kbd_read:
 36882 0000388E F606[EB46]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 36883 00003893 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 36884                                  
 36885 00003895 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 36886 00003896 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 36887 00003898 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 36888                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 36889                                  kbd_loop:
 36890 0000389A B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 36891 0000389C CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 36892 0000389E 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 36893 000038A0 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 36894 000038A2 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36895 000038A4 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 36896 000038A6 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 36897 000038A8 A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 36898                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 36899                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36900 000038AB 2E2B06[8603]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 36901                                  
 36902 000038B0 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 36903 000038B2 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 36904                                  kbd_loopdone:
 36905 000038B4 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 36906                                  kbd_nodelay:
 36907 000038B5 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 36908 000038B7 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 36909 000038B9 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36910 000038BB A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 36911 000038BD 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 36912 000038BF 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 36913 000038C0 43                              inc     bx
 36914                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 36915 000038C1 800E[EF46]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 36916                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 36917 000038C6 B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 36918 000038C8 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36919 000038CA 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 36920 000038CC 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 36921 000038CE 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 36922                                  
 36923                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 36924 000038D0 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 36925 000038D3 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 36926                                  	
 36927 000038D5 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 36928 000038D8 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 36929                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 36930 000038DA BA[834B]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 36931 000038DD E8DD0B                          call    print
 36932                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 36933 000038E0 800E[EF46]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 36934 000038E5 EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 36935                                  kbd_notf5:
 36936                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 36937 000038E7 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 36938 000038EA 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 36939                                  
 36940 000038EC 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 36941 000038EF 7523                            jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 36942                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 36943 000038F1 BA[C14B]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 36944 000038F4 E8C60B                          call    print           ;
 36945 000038F7 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 36946 000038F9 881E[EF46]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 36947                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 36948 000038FD B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 36949 000038FF CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 36950 00003901 C606[F546]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 36951 00003906 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 36952 00003908 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 36953                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 36954 0000390A 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 36955 0000390D 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 36956                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 36957 0000390F E86E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 36958 00003912 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 36959 00003913 C3                              retn			;
 36960                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 36961 00003914 F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 36962 00003915 C3                              retn			;
 36963                                  
 36964                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36965                                  ;
 36966                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 36967                                  ;
 36968                                  ;   INPUT
 36969                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 36970                                  ;
 36971                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36972                                  ;       None
 36973                                  ;
 36974                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36975                                  ;       None
 36976                                  ;
 36977                                  ;   HISTORY
 36978                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 36979                                  ;
 36980                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36981                                  
 36982                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36983                                  
 36984                                  set_numlock:
 36985                                          ; 04/01/2023
 36986                                  	;push	ax
 36987 00003916 1E                              push    ds
 36988 00003917 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 36989 00003919 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 36990 0000391B 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 36991 0000391E 2E3B06[5E4B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 36992 00003923 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 36993 00003925 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 36994 0000392A EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 36995                                  not_off:
 36996 0000392C 2E3B06[5C4B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 36997 00003931 F9                              stc
 36998 00003932 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 36999 00003934 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 37000                                  set_done:
 37001 00003939 1F                              pop     ds
 37002                                  	; 04/01/2023
 37003                                  	;pop	ax
 37004 0000393A C3                              retn
 37005                                  
 37006                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37007                                  
 37008                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37009                                  ;
 37010                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 37011                                  ;
 37012                                  ;   INPUT
 37013                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 37014                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 37015                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 37016                                  ;
 37017                                  ;   OUTPUT
 37018                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 37019                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 37020                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 37021                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 37022                                  ;
 37023                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 37024                                  ;       All
 37025                                  ;
 37026                                  ;   NOTES
 37027                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 37028                                  ;
 37029                                  ;   HISTORY
 37030                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 37031                                  ;
 37032                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37033                                  
 37034                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 37035                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 37036                                  
 37037                                  menu_check:
 37038                                  
 37039                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 37040                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 37041                                  
 37042 0000393B 51                              push    cx              ;
 37043 0000393C 56                              push    si              ;
 37044 0000393D 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 37045                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 37046 0000393F E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 37047 00003942 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 37048 00003944 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 37049 00003946 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 37050 00003948 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 37051 00003949 EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 37052                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 37053 0000394B 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 37054 0000394D 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 37055 0000394F 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 37056 00003951 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 37057 00003953 E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 37058 00003956 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 37059 0000395B EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 37060                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 37061 0000395D 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 37062 0000395F 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 37063                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 37064 00003961 E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 37065                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 37066 00003964 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 37067 00003966 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 37068 00003968 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 37069 0000396A 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 37070 0000396C E80807                          call    get_char        ;
 37071 0000396F 24DF                            and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 37072 00003971 3A06[A51E]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]	; 'N'
 37073 00003975 7507                            jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 37074 00003977 800E[EB46]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 37075 0000397C EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 37076                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 37077 0000397E 3A06[B11E]                      cmp     al,[swit_f+1]	; 'F'
 37078 00003982 75E0                            jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 37079 00003984 800E[EB46]02                    or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 37080 00003989 EBD6                            jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 37081                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 37082 0000398B E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 37083 0000398E EBAF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 37084                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 37085 00003990 5E                              pop     si              ;
 37086 00003991 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37087                                  
 37088                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 37089                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 37090                                  
 37091 00003992 F606[EB46]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 37092 00003997 7508                            jnz	short menu_search
 37093                                  ;
 37094                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 37095                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 37096                                  ;
 37097 00003999 E8F2FE                          call    kbd_read
 37098 0000399C 7303                            jnc	short menu_search
 37099 0000399E E9EE01                          jmp	menu_abort
 37100                                  
 37101                                  ;   Search for MENU block; it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 37102                                  
 37103                                  menu_search:
 37104 000039A1 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 37105 000039A3 BF[3047]                        mov     di,szMenu	;
 37106 000039A6 E80304                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 37107 000039A9 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;
 37108 000039AB C606[2847]00                    mov     byte [szBoot],0
 37109 000039B0 E90C02                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 37110                                  
 37111                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 37112                                  
 37113                                  menu_color:
 37114 000039B3 51                      	push	cx              ;
 37115 000039B4 52                      	push	dx              ;
 37116                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 37117                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37118                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 37119 000039B5 E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 37120 000039B8 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 37121 000039BB 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 37122                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 37123                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 37124                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 37125                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 37126 000039BD 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 37127 000039BF E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 37128 000039C2 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 37129 000039C4 E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 37130 000039C7 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 37131 000039CA 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 37132                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37133                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 37134 000039CC B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 37135 000039CE D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 37136 000039D0 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 37137                                  check_color:
 37138 000039D2 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 37139 000039D4 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 37140 000039D6 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 37141                                  set_color:
 37142 000039D9 8816[E646]              	mov	[bMenuColor],dl ;
 37143 000039DD 5A                      	pop	dx              ;
 37144 000039DE 59                      	pop	cx              ;
 37145 000039DF E9A900                  	jmp	menu_nextitem
 37146                                  
 37147                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 37148                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 37149                                  
 37150                                  menu_found:
 37151 000039E2 C606[F046]01                    mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 37152                                          ;mov	word [offDefBlock],0
 37153 000039E7 C606[F446]FF                    mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 37154 000039EC 8026[EF46]FD                    and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 37155                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37156 000039F1 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx
 37157 000039F3 8916[F246]              	mov	[offDefBlock],dx ; 0
 37158                                  
 37159 000039F7 E85706                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 37160                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37161                                  	;sub	dx,dx		; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 37162                                  
 37163                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 37164                                  
 37165                                  menu_process:
 37166 000039FA E87A06                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 37167 000039FD 722E                            jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 37168 000039FF 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 37169 00003A01 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END

 37186 00003A23 E82607                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!

 37188                                  menu_numlock:

 37190 00003A2B EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 37191                                  to_menu_getdefault:

 37193                                  
 37194                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 37195                                  
 37196                                  menu_default:

 37198 00003A33 803E[F546]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0

 37207                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 37208 00003A4C 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 37209 00003A4E B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 37210                                  timeout_ok:                    ;
 37211 00003A50 881E[F446]                      mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 37212                                  timeout_skip:
 37213 00003A54 EB35                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 37214                                  
 37215                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 37216                                  
 37217                                  menu_item:
 37218                                  	;cmp	dl,9	; 04/01/2023
 37219 00003A56 80FA09                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 37220 00003A59 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 37221 00003A5B 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 37222 00003A5D E83303                          call    srch_block      ;
 37223 00003A60 7406                            je	short menu_itemfound ;
 37224 00003A62 F9                              stc                     ;
 37225 00003A63 E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 37226 00003A66 EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 37227                                  
 37228                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 37229                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 37230                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 37231                                  
 37232                                  menu_itemfound:
 37233 00003A68 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 37234 00003A69 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 37235 00003A6B 8887[F646]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 37236 00003A6F 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 37237                                  
 37238                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 37239                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 37240                                  ;   description...
 37241                                  
 37242 00003A71 89B7[0047]                      mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 37243 00003A75 89B7[1447]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 37244 00003A79 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 37245 00003A7B E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;

 37247 00003A80 E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 37248 00003A83 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 37249 00003A85 87DF                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 37250 00003A87 89BF[1447]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 37251                                  
 37252                                  menu_nextitem:
 37253 00003A8B E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 37254 00003A8E E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 37255                                  
 37256                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 37257                                  
 37258                                  menu_getdefault:
 37259 00003A91 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 37260 00003A93 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 37261 00003A95 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 37262 00003A97 E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 37263                                  menu_valid:
 37264 00003A9A 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 37265 00003A9C 8816[F146]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 37266 00003AA0 8B3E[F246]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 37267 00003AA4 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 37268 00003AA6 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 37269 00003AA8 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 37270                                  menu_chkdefault:
 37271 00003AA9 53                              push    bx              ;
 37272 00003AAA 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 37273 00003AAC 8BB7[0047]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 37274 00003AB0 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 37275 00003AB3 1E                              push    ds              ;
 37276 00003AB4 06                              push    es              ;
 37277 00003AB5 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37278 00003AB6 E81A03                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 37279 00003AB9 1F                              pop     ds              ;

 37282 00003ABD 43                              inc     bx              ;

 37284 00003AC2 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 37285                                  menu_nodefault:
 37286 00003AC4 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 37287                                  menu_setdefault:
 37288 00003AC6 881E[F046]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 37289                                  
 37290                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 37291                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 37292                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 37293                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 37294                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 37295                                  ;   with no timeout)
 37296                                  
 37297 00003ACA 803E[F446]00                    cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 37298 00003ACF 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no

 37300 00003AD6 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 37301 00003AD8 E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 37302                                  
 37303                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 37304                                  
 37305                                  menu_display:
 37306 00003ADB B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 37307 00003ADD CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37308 00003ADF B400                            mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 37309 00003AE1 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37310 00003AE3 06                              push    es              ;
 37311 00003AE4 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 37312 00003AE7 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 37313 00003AE9 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the

 37318 00003AFA CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37319 00003AFC B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 37320 00003AFF 8A3E[E646]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 37321 00003B03 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 37322                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 37323 00003B05 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 37324 00003B0A FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 37325                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 37326 00003B0C 268A368400                      mov	dh,[es:84h]
 37327 00003B11 08F6                    	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 37328 00003B13 7504                            jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 37329 00003B15 8A36[EA46]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 37330                                  menu_clear:
 37331 00003B19 CD10                            int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 37332 00003B1B 07                              pop     es              ;
 37333 00003B1C 8836[EA46]                      mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 37334 00003B20 BA[FE4B]                        mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 37335 00003B23 E89709                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 37336                                  
 37337 00003B26 F606[EB46]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 37338 00003B2B 751F                            jnz     short menu_nostatus
 37339 00003B2D 8A3E[E746]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 37340 00003B31 8A36[EA46]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 37341 00003B35 B200                            mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 37342 00003B37 B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 37343 00003B39 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37344 00003B3B BA[4C4C]                        mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 37345 00003B3E E87C09                          call    print           ;
 37346 00003B41 B403                            mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 37347 00003B43 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37348 00003B45 80EA02                          sub     dl,2            ;
 37349 00003B48 8816[E946]                      mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 37350                                  
 37351                                  menu_nostatus:
 37352 00003B4C BB0100                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 37353                                  menu_disploop:
 37354 00003B4F E8B002                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 37355 00003B52 43                              inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"? because it's a 1-byte opcode
 37356 00003B53 3A1E[F146]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 37357 00003B57 76F6                            jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 37358                                  
 37359                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 37360                                  
 37361 00003B59 B200                            mov     dl,0            ; select column
 37362 00003B5B 88DE                            mov     dh,bl           ;
 37363 00003B5D 80C604                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 37364 00003B60 8A3E[E746]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 37365 00003B64 B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 37366 00003B66 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 37367                                  
 37368 00003B68 BA[394C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 37369 00003B6B E84F09                          call    print           ;
 37370 00003B6E E82903                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 37371 00003B71 BA[0A4A]                        mov     dx,crlfm	
 37372 00003B74 E84609                          call    print           ;
 37373 00003B77 FF36[EB46]                      push    word [bDisableUI]
 37374 00003B7B 800E[EB46]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 37375 00003B80 E86704                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 37376 00003B83 8F06[EB46]                      pop     word [bDisableUI]
 37377                                  
 37378                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 37379                                  
 37380                                  menu_autoselect:
 37381 00003B87 83FBFF                          cmp     bx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; clean boot requested?
 37382 00003B8A 7508                            jne	short normal_boot ; no

 37384                                  menu_abort:

 37386 00003B91 E9E400                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 37387                                  
 37388                                  normal_boot:
 37389 00003B94 83FBFE                          cmp     bx,-2 ; 0FFFEh	; back to top-level menu?
 37390 00003B97 7509                            jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 37391 00003B99 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 37392 00003B9D 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 37393 00003B9F E9FFFD                          jmp     menu_search
 37394                                  
 37395                                  not_topmenu:
 37396 00003BA2 80BF[F646]4F                    cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 37397 00003BA7 7510                            jne	short not_submenu
 37398 00003BA9 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 37399 00003BAB 8BBF[0047]                      mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 37400 00003BAF E8E101                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 37401 00003BB2 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 37402 00003BB4 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 37403 00003BB6 E929FE                          jmp     menu_found
 37404                                  
 37405                                  not_submenu:
 37406 00003BB9 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 37407 00003BBB 8B9F[0047]                      mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 37408                                  
 37409                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 37410                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 37411                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 37412                                  
 37413                                  no_selection:
 37414 00003BBF 891E[F246]                      mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 37415 00003BC3 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 37416 00003BC7 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 37417 00003BC9 1E                              push    ds              ;
 37418 00003BCA 8E1E[A214]                      mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 37419 00003BCE 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 37420                                  
 37421                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 37422                                  ;
 37423                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 37424                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 37425                                  ;   within the requested block. Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 37426                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion; the amount of recursion is
 37427                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 37428                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 37429                                  ;
 37430                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 37431                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 37432                                  
 37433                                  copyblock_loop:
 37434 00003BD0 53                              push    bx              ; save selected block name
 37435 00003BD1 E82F01                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 37436 00003BD4 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 37437 00003BD5 7232                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 37438                                  
 37439                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons: it hit eof or a new block
 37440                                  
 37441                                  copyblock_begin:
 37442                                  
 37443                                  ; 10/09/2023
 37444                                  %if 0
 37445                                          push    ax              ;
 37446                                          push    cx              ;
 37447                                          push    si              ;
 37448                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 37449                                          mov     di,szCommon
 37450                                          push    ds              ;
 37451                                          push    cs              ;
 37452                                          pop     ds              ;
 37453                                          call    comp_names      ;
 37454                                          pop     ds              ;
 37455                                          pop     di              ;
 37456                                          pop     si              ;
 37457                                          pop     cx              ;
 37458                                          pop     ax              ;
 37459                                          je	short copyblock_check
 37460                                  %endif
 37461                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37462 00003BD7 57                      	push	di
 37463 00003BD8 BF[3547]                	mov	di,szCommon	; always do "common" blocks
 37464 00003BDB E81602                  	call	comp_names_x	; (comp_names_safe)
 37465 00003BDE 5F                      	pop	di
 37466 00003BDF 740F                    	je	short copyblock_check
 37467                                  
 37468 00003BE1 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 37469 00003BE3 7414                            jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 37470 00003BE5 57                              push    di              ;
 37471 00003BE6 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 37472 00003BE8 1E                              push    ds              ;
 37473 00003BE9 06                              push    es              ;
 37474 00003BEA 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37475 00003BEB E8E501                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 37476 00003BEE 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37477 00003BEF 5F                              pop     di              ;
 37478                                  copyblock_check:
 37479 00003BF0 7217                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 37480 00003BF2 7505                            jne	short copyblock_skip ;
 37481 00003BF4 E85A04                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 37482 00003BF7 EBD7                            jmp	short copyblock_loop
 37483                                  
 37484                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 37485 00003BF9 E85504                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 37486 00003BFC E87804                          call    get_char        ;
 37487 00003BFF 7208                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 37488 00003C01 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 37489 00003C03 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 37490 00003C05 74D0                            je	short copyblock_begin
 37491 00003C07 EBF0                            jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 37492                                  ;
 37493                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 37494                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 37495                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 37496                                  ;
 37497                                  move_config:
 37498 00003C09 89F9                            mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 37499 00003C0B 51                              push    cx              ;
 37500                                  ;
 37501                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 37502                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 37503                                  ;
 37504                                   	;mov	cx,7
 37505 00003C0C B90700                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 37506 00003C0F BE[2847]                        mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 37507 00003C12 47                              inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 37508                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 37509                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 37510                                  copy_boot: 
 37511                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 37512 00003C13 2E                              cs
 37513 00003C14 AC                      	lodsb
 37514 00003C15 8805                    	mov     [di],al         ;
 37515 00003C17 47                              inc     di              ;
 37516 00003C18 E2F9                            loop    copy_boot       ;
 37517                                  
 37518 00003C1A 06                              push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 37519                                          ;mov	cx,128-7	; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 37520                                  	; 04/01/2023
 37521 00003C1B B179                    	mov	cl,128-7
 37522 00003C1D 2E8B36[F246]            	mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
 37523 00003C22 09F6                            or      si,si           ; valid?
 37524 00003C24 7505                            jnz	short l1	; yes
 37525 00003C26 0E                              push    cs              ;
 37526 00003C27 07                              pop     es              ;
 37527 00003C28 BE[3547]                        mov     si,szCommon
 37528 00003C2B 268A04                  l1:     mov     al,[es:si]      ;
 37529 00003C2E E8B205                          call    any_delim       ;
 37530 00003C31 7406                            je	short l2	;
 37531 00003C33 8805                            mov     [di],al         ;
 37532 00003C35 46                              inc     si              ;
 37533 00003C36 47                              inc     di              ;
 37534 00003C37 E2F2                            loop    l1              ;
 37535 00003C39 C6050A                  l2:     mov     byte [di],lf	; terminate the configuration string
 37536 00003C3C 07                              pop     es              ;
 37537                                  
 37538                                  ;   Now we can copy "config_wrkseg" (DS) to "confbot" (ES)
 37539                                  
 37540 00003C3D 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 37541 00003C3F 2E893E[A014]                    mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 37542 00003C44 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 37543 00003C46 59                              pop     cx              ; recover the size of "config_wrkseg"
 37544                                  
 37545 00003C47 51                              push    cx              ;
 37546 00003C48 F3A4                            rep     movsb           ; moved!
 37547 00003C4A 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37548 00003C4B 8CD8                            mov     ax,ds           ;
 37549 00003C4D 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37550                                  
 37551                                  ;   Now that the config_wrkseg is available once again, we shall
 37552                                  ;   use it to create an environment. The first thing to go in will be
 37553                                  ;   the "CONFIG=configuration" thing. It is also important to zero
 37554                                  ;   the first byte of the workspace, so that copy_envvar knows the buffer
 37555                                  ;   is empty.
 37556                                  
 37557 00003C4E 06                              push    es              ;
 37558 00003C4F 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ;
 37559 00003C51 46                              inc     si              ; ES:SI -> "CONFIG=configuration"
 37560 00003C52 26C606000000                    mov     byte [es:0],0	;empty the environment block
 37561 00003C58 E82600                          call    copy_envvar     ; copy envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 37562 00003C5B 07                              pop     es
 37563                                  
 37564                                  ;   Before returning, restore the default video page setting but do NOT
 37565                                  ;   do it using INT 10h's Set Active Page function, because if the menu was
 37566                                  ;   displayed on a different page, then it's because we don't want to see
 37567                                  ;   all the device driver/TSR goop (which goes to the default page)
 37568                                  
 37569                                  menu_done:
 37570 00003C5C 803E[E746]00                    cmp     byte [bMenuPage],0
 37571 00003C61 7415                            je	short menu_exit	;
 37572 00003C63 06                              push    es              ;
 37573 00003C64 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ;
 37574 00003C67 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ;
 37575 00003C69 A1[ED46]                        mov     ax,[wCRTStart]  ;
 37576 00003C6C 26A34E00                        mov     [es:004Eh],ax   ;
 37577 00003C70 A0[EC46]                        mov     al,[bCRTPage]   ;
 37578 00003C73 26A26200                        mov     [es:0062h],al   ;
 37579 00003C77 07                              pop     es              ;
 37580                                  menu_exit:
 37581 00003C78 890E[5603]                      mov     [count],cx      ; set new counts
 37582 00003C7C 890E[5803]                      mov     [org_count],cx  ;
 37583                                          ; 10/09/2023 (*) - Erdogan Tan
 37584                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:46D3h
 37585                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:491Ah
 37586                                  	;sub	si,si           ; always return ES:SI pointing to config.sys
 37587 00003C80 C3                      	retn
 37588                                  
 37589                                  ; (*) NOTE: MSDOS 6.0 source code (SYSINIT2.ASM) contains 'sub si,si' at this
 37590                                  ;	position (then 'retn' just after it)
 37591                                  ;	but MSDOS 6.21 and PCDOS 7.1 SYSINITs contain only 'retn' here.
 37592                                  
 37593                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37594                                  ;
 37595                                  ;   copy_envvar:  copy the envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 37596                                  ;
 37597                                  ;   INPUT
 37598                                  ;    ES:SI -> environment variable (in the form "var=string<cr/lf>")
 37599                                  ;
 37600                                  ;   OUTPUT
 37601                                  ;       config_envlen (ie, where to put next envvar) updated appropriately
 37602                                  ;       carry set if error (eg, missing =); clear otherwise
 37603                                  ;
 37604                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 37605                                  ;       None
 37606                                  ;
 37607                                  ;   NOTES
 37608                                  ;       None
 37609                                  ;
 37610                                  ;   HISTORY
 37611                                  ;       Created 29-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 37612                                  ;
 37613                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37614                                  
 37615                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 37616                                  	; (SYSINIT:46D4h)
 37617                                  
 37618                                  copy_envvar:
 37619 00003C81 51                              push    cx              ;
 37620 00003C82 56                              push    si              ;
 37621 00003C83 1E                              push    ds              ;
 37622 00003C84 06                              push    es              ;
 37623 00003C85 06                              push    es              ;
 37624 00003C86 8E06[A214]                      mov     es,[config_wrkseg] ; ES:DI to point to next available byte
 37625 00003C8A 1F                              pop     ds                 ; DS:SI to point to envvar
 37626                                  
 37627                                  ;   Have to calculate the length of the variable name (and if we hit
 37628                                  ;   the end of the line before we hit '=', then it's curtains for this
 37629                                  ;   config.sys line)
 37630                                  ;
 37631                                  ;   The check for NULL is important because copy_envvar is also used to copy
 37632                                  ;   the initial CONFIG= setting, which will have been zapped by a NULL if no
 37633                                  ;   menu block existed (in order to prevent the creation of an environment)
 37634                                  
 37635 00003C8B 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ;
 37636                                  copy_varlen:                    ;
 37637 00003C8D AC                              lodsb                   ;
 37638 00003C8E 08C0                            or      al,al           ; NULL?
 37639                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 37640 00003C90 746B                            jz	short copy_envexit ; yes, abort
 37641 00003C92 3C0D                            cmp     al,cr           ;
 37642                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 37643 00003C94 7467                            je	short copy_envexit
 37644 00003C96 3C0A                            cmp     al,lf           ;
 37645                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 37646 00003C98 7463                            je	short copy_envexit
 37647 00003C9A 41                              inc     cx              ;
 37648 00003C9B 3C3D                            cmp     al,'='          ;
 37649 00003C9D 75EE                            jne	short copy_varlen
 37650 00003C9F B000                            mov     al,0            ;
 37651 00003CA1 8A24                            mov     ah,[si]         ; save char after '='
 37652 00003CA3 29CE                            sub     si,cx           ; back up to given varname
 37653 00003CA5 49                              dec     cx              ; CX == # of bytes in varname
 37654 00003CA6 29FF                            sub     di,di           ; start looking for DS:SI at ES:0
 37655                                  copy_varsrch:
 37656 00003CA8 263805                          cmp     byte [es:di],al
 37657 00003CAB 7425                            je	short copy_envprep ; search failed, just copy var
 37658 00003CAD 89FB                            mov     bx,di           ; ES:BX -> start of this varname
 37659 00003CAF 51                              push    cx              ;
 37660 00003CB0 56                              push    si              ;
 37661 00003CB1 F3A6                            repe    cmpsb           ;
 37662 00003CB3 5E                              pop     si              ;
 37663 00003CB4 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37664 00003CB5 7531                            jne	short copy_varnext ; no match, skip to next varname
 37665 00003CB7 26803D3D                        cmp     byte [es:di],'='
 37666 00003CBB 752B                            jne     short copy_varnext ; no match, there's more characters
 37667                                  
 37668                                  ;   Previous occurrence of variable has been found; determine the
 37669                                  ;   entire length and then destroy it
 37670                                  
 37671 00003CBD B9FFFF                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 37672 00003CC0 F2AE                            repne   scasb           ; guaranteed to get null (since we put it there)
 37673 00003CC2 56                              push    si              ;
 37674 00003CC3 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 37675 00003CC5 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ;
 37676 00003CC7 2E8B0E[A014]                    mov     cx,[cs:config_envlen]
 37677 00003CCC 29F1                            sub     cx,si           ; destroy variable now
 37678                                  	;rep movs byte ptr es:[di],byte ptr es:[si]
 37679                                  	;;db 0F3h,26h,0A4h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4724h
 37680                                  
 37681 00003CCE F3                      	rep	; 0F3h
 37682 00003CCF 26                      	es	; 26h
 37683 00003CD0 A4                      	movsb	; 0A4h
 37684                                  
 37685 00003CD1 5E                      	pop     si
 37686                                  copy_envprep:
 37687 00003CD2 80FC0D                          cmp     ah,cr          ; if there is nothing after the '='
 37688 00003CD5 741D                            je	short copy_envdel ; then just exit with variable deleted
 37689 00003CD7 80FC0A                          cmp     ah,lf           ;
 37690 00003CDA 7418                            je	short copy_envdel
 37691                                          ;jmp	short copy_envloop
 37692                                  	; 04/01/2023
 37693                                  copy_envloop:                  ;
 37694 00003CDC AC                      	lodsb                   ;
 37695 00003CDD 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr           ;
 37696 00003CDF 7410                    	je	short copy_envdone
 37697 00003CE1 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf           ;
 37698 00003CE3 740C                    	je	short copy_envdone
 37699 00003CE5 AA                      	stosb                   ;
 37700 00003CE6 EBF4                    	jmp	short copy_envloop
 37701                                  
 37702                                  copy_varnext:                   ;
 37703 00003CE8 51                              push    cx              ;
 37704 00003CE9 B9FFFF                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 37705 00003CEC F2AE                            repne   scasb           ;
 37706 00003CEE 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37707 00003CEF EBB7                            jmp	short copy_varsrch
 37708                                  
 37709                                  	; 04/01/2023
 37710                                  ;copy_envloop:                  ;
 37711                                  ;	lodsb                   ;
 37712                                  ;	cmp	al,cr           ;
 37713                                  ;	je	short copy_envdone
 37714                                  ;	cmp	al,lf           ;
 37715                                  ;	je	short copy_envdone
 37716                                  ;	stosb                   ;
 37717                                  ;	jmp	short copy_envloop
 37718                                  
 37719                                  copy_envdone:                   ;
 37720 00003CF1 28C0                            sub     al,al           ; do SUB to clear carry as well
 37721 00003CF3 AA                              stosb                   ; always null-terminate these puppies
 37722                                  copy_envdel:                    ;
 37723 00003CF4 268805                          mov     [es:di],al      ; and stick another null to terminate the env.
 37724 00003CF7 2E893E[A014]                    mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 37725                                  	; 10/09/2023 (x) - Erdogan Tan
 37726 00003CFC F9                      	stc ; in order to clear carry flag via cmc (compact code trick!)
 37727                                  copy_envexit:                   ;
 37728 00003CFD F5                      	cmc ; (x) ; reverse carry flag status (je -> cf=1)
 37729 00003CFE 07                              pop     es              ;
 37730 00003CFF 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37731 00003D00 5E                              pop     si              ;
 37732 00003D01 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37733                                  
 37734                                  copy_done:	; 18/12/2022
 37735 00003D02 C3                              retn
 37736                                  
 37737                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37738                                  ;
 37739                                  ;   copy_block:  copy the current block to the new config.sys workspace
 37740                                  ;
 37741                                  ;   INPUT
 37742                                  ;       CX == remaining bytes in "organized" config.sys memory image
 37743                                  ;    ES:SI -> remaining bytes in "organized" config.sys memory image
 37744                                  ;    DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace (equal in size to the original
 37745                                  ;             config.sys image) where the current block is to be copied
 37746                                  ;
 37747                                  ;   OUTPUT
 37748                                  ;       Same as above
 37749                                  ;       AL also equals the last character read from the organized image
 37750                                  ;
 37751                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 37752                                  ;       All
 37753                                  ;
 37754                                  ;   NOTES
 37755                                  ;       None
 37756                                  ;
 37757                                  ;   HISTORY
 37758                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 37759                                  ;
 37760                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37761                                  
 37762                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 37763                                  	; (SYSINIT:4759h)
 37764                                  
 37765                                  copy_block:
 37766 00003D03 E87103                          call    get_char        ; check for include
 37767 00003D06 72FA                            jc	short copy_done	;
 37768 00003D08 247F                    	and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 37769 00003D0A 3C5B                    	cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; another BEGIN implies END as well
 37770 00003D0C 74F4                            je	short copy_done ;
 37771                                  
 37772 00003D0E 3C4A                            cmp     al,CONFIG_INCLUDE ; 'J'
 37773 00003D10 88E0                            mov     al,ah           ; AL == the original line code
 37774 00003D12 753A                            jne	short copy_line	; not an "include" line
 37775                                  
 37776                                  ;   We have hit an "INCLUDE" line; first, REM out the line so that we
 37777                                  ;   never try to include the block again (no infinite include loops please),
 37778                                  ;   then search for the named block and call copy_block again.
 37779                                  
 37780 00003D14 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM ; '0'
 37781 00003D19 57                              push    di              ;
 37782                                  
 37783 00003D1A BF[3047]                        mov     di,szMenu
 37784 00003D1D E8D400                          call    comp_names_safe ; don't allow INCLUDE MENU
 37785 00003D20 7426                            je	short copy_skip	;
 37786                                  
 37787 00003D22 BF[3547]                        mov     di,szCommon
 37788 00003D25 E8CC00                          call    comp_names_safe ; don't allow INCLUDE COMMON
 37789 00003D28 741E                            je	short copy_skip	;
 37790                                  
 37791 00003D2A 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; try to find the block
 37792 00003D2C E86400                          call    srch_block      ;
 37793 00003D2F 89FA                            mov     dx,di           ;
 37794                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37795                                  	;pop    di              ;
 37796 00003D31 7514                            jne	short copy_error ; no such block
 37797 00003D33 5F                      	pop	di  ; 10/09/2023
 37798 00003D34 51                              push    cx              ;
 37799 00003D35 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ;
 37800 00003D37 56                              push    si              ;
 37801 00003D38 4A                              dec     dx              ;
 37802 00003D39 89D6                            mov     si,dx           ;
 37803 00003D3B E80E03                          call    skip_line       ; skip the rest of the "block name" line
 37804 00003D3E E8C2FF                          call    copy_block      ; and copy in the rest of that block
 37805 00003D41 5E                              pop     si              ;
 37806 00003D42 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37807 00003D43 28C0                            sub     al,al           ; force skip_opt_line to skip...
 37808 00003D45 EB2B                            jmp     short copy_nextline
 37809                                  
 37810                                  copy_error:
 37811                                  	; 10/09/2023
 37812 00003D47 F8                      	clc
 37813                                  copy_skip:
 37814 00003D48 5F                              pop     di
 37815                                  ;copy_error:
 37816                                  	; 10/09/2023 (cf=0)
 37817                                  	;clc                    ;
 37818 00003D49 E80004                          call    print_error     ; note that carry is clear, no pause
 37819 00003D4C EB24                            jmp     short copy_nextline
 37820                                  
 37821                                  ;   Copy the line at ES:SI to the current location at DS:DI
 37822                                  
 37823                                  copy_line:
 37824 00003D4E 8805                            mov     [di],al         ;
 37825 00003D50 47                              inc     di              ;
 37826 00003D51 3C20                            cmp     al,' '          ; is this is a "real" line with a "real" code?
 37827 00003D53 721D                            jb	short copy_nextline ; no
 37828 00003D55 2E803E[A514]00                  cmp     byte [cs:config_multi],0
 37829 00003D5B 7409                            je	short copy_loop	; not a multi-config config.sys, don't embed #s
 37830 00003D5D E81700                          call    get_linenum	; BX == line # of line @ES:SI
 37831 00003D60 891D                            mov     [di],bx         ; stash it immediately following the line code
 37832 00003D62 47                              inc     di              ;
 37833 00003D63 47                              inc     di              ;
 37834 00003D64 EB08                            jmp     short copy_next ;
 37835                                  copy_loop:                      ;
 37836 00003D66 E80E03                          call    get_char        ;
 37837 00003D69 7297                            jc	short copy_done ; end of file
 37838 00003D6B 8805                            mov     [di],al         ;
 37839 00003D6D 47                              inc     di              ;
 37840                                  copy_next:
 37841 00003D6E 3C0A                            cmp     al,lf ; 0Ah	; done with line?
 37842 00003D70 75F4                            jne	short copy_loop	; nope
 37843                                  
 37844                                  copy_nextline:
 37845 00003D72 E8DC02                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 37846 00003D75 EB8C                            jmp     short copy_block
 37847                                  
 37848                                  	; 18/12/2022
 37849                                  ;copy_done:
 37850                                          ;retn
 37851                                  
 37852                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37853                                  ;
 37854                                  ;   get_linenum:  return line # (in BX) of current line (@ES:SI)
 37855                                  ;
 37856                                  ;   INPUT
 37857                                  ;    ES:SI -> some line in the config.sys memory image
 37858                                  ;
 37859                                  ;   OUTPUT
 37860                                  ;       BX == line # (relative to 1)
 37861                                  ;
 37862                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 37863                                  ;       DX
 37864                                  ;
 37865                                  ;   NOTES
 37866                                  ;       None
 37867                                  ;
 37868                                  ;   HISTORY
 37869                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 37870                                  ;
 37871                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37872                                  
 37873                                  get_linenum:
 37874 00003D77 50                              push    ax              ;
 37875 00003D78 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; BX == line # (to be returned)
 37876 00003D7A 51                              push    cx              ;
 37877 00003D7B 89F2                            mov     dx,si           ; DX == the offset we're looking for
 37878 00003D7D 56                              push    si              ;
 37879 00003D7E 2E8B0E[5603]                    mov     cx,[cs:count]   ;
 37880 00003D83 29F6                            sub     si,si           ; prepare to scan entire file
 37881                                  get_linenum_loop:               ;
 37882 00003D85 E8C402                          call    skip_line       ;
 37883 00003D88 7205                            jc	short get_linenum_done
 37884 00003D8A 43                              inc     bx              ;
 37885 00003D8B 39D6                            cmp     si,dx           ; have we exceeded the desired offset yet?
 37886 00003D8D 72F6                            jb	short get_linenum_loop ; no
 37887                                  get_linenum_done:               ;
 37888 00003D8F 5E                              pop     si              ;
 37889 00003D90 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37890 00003D91 58                              pop     ax              ;
 37891 00003D92 C3                              retn
 37892                                  
 37893                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37894                                  ;
 37895                                  ;   srch_block:  searches entire config.sys for block name @ES:DI
 37896                                  ;
 37897                                  ;   INPUT
 37898                                  ;       ES -> config.sys image
 37899                                  ;    ES:DI -> block name to find
 37900                                  ;
 37901                                  ;   OUTPUT
 37902                                  ;       ZF flag set, if found
 37903                                  ;    ES:DI -> just past the name in the block heading, if found
 37904                                  ;       BX == # bytes remaining from that point, if found
 37905                                  ;
 37906                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 37907                                  ;       None
 37908                                  ;
 37909                                  ;   NOTES
 37910                                  ;       This differs from "find_block" in that it searches the ENTIRE
 37911                                  ;       config.sys image, not merely the remaining portion, and that it
 37912                                  ;       takes a pointer to block name that is *elsewhere* in the image
 37913                                  ;       (ie, ES) as opposed to some string constant in our own segment (DS).
 37914                                  ;
 37915                                  ;   HISTORY
 37916                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 37917                                  ;
 37918                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37919                                  
 37920                                  srch_block:	          ; returns BX -> named block in CONFIG.SYS
 37921 00003D93 50                              push    ax              ;
 37922 00003D94 51                              push    cx              ;
 37923 00003D95 2E8B0E[5603]                    mov     cx,[cs:count]   ;
 37924 00003D9A 56                              push    si              ;
 37925 00003D9B 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 37926 00003D9D 1E                              push    ds              ;
 37927 00003D9E 06                              push    es              ;
 37928 00003D9F 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37929 00003DA0 E80900                          call    find_block      ;
 37930 00003DA3 89F7                            mov     di,si           ;
 37931 00003DA5 89CB                            mov     bx,cx           ;
 37932 00003DA7 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 37933 00003DA8 5E                              pop     si              ;
 37934 00003DA9 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37935 00003DAA 58                              pop     ax              ;
 37936                                  find_exit: ; 16/04/2019
 37937 00003DAB C3                              retn			;
 37938                                  
 37939                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37940                                  ;
 37941                                  ;   find_block:  searches rest of config.sys for block name @DS:DI
 37942                                  ;
 37943                                  ;   INPUT
 37944                                  ;    DS:DI -> block name to find
 37945                                  ;    ES:SI -> remainder of config.sys image
 37946                                  ;       CX == remaining size of config.sys image
 37947                                  ;
 37948                                  ;   OUTPUT
 37949                                  ;       ZF flag set, if found (also, CF set if EOF)
 37950                                  ;    ES:SI -> where the search stopped (at end of block name or EOF)
 37951                                  ;       CX == # bytes remaining from that point
 37952                                  ;
 37953                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 37954                                  ;       AX
 37955                                  ;
 37956                                  ;   NOTES
 37957                                  ;       This differs from "srch_block" in that it searches only the
 37958                                  ;       remaining portion of the config.sys image and leaves SI and CX
 37959                                  ;       pointing to where the search left off, and that it takes a pointer
